description: ROWAYTON, Conn., Sept. 2In the United Church of Rowayton this afternoon, Miss Sarah Roberts Cross and Kevin Christopher Cunningham were married by the Rev. Donald Wesley Emig. The bride is a daughter of Mrs. Hunter Cross of Washington and Dr. Charles Joseph Cross of Columbus, Ohio. The bridegroom is a son of Mrs. David Rait Richardson of Westport and John Miskell Cunningham of New York.

title: Free Checkups for Inmates
description: TRENTON, Sept. 2The New Jersey Medical Society and Dental Association have agreed to ask their members to give free medical examinations to inmates of Rahway and Trenton State Prisons, according to the State Institutions Commissioner, Robert L. Clifford.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: I read with a great deal of interest the article Our Home Burned, But We Stayed Cool [Aug. 6] because we had a fire resulting in approximately the same amount of damage In our home several years ago.

description: One third of the 930,000 residents of Essex County report a language other than English as their mother tongue.

title: Army Ends Mylai Review; 3 More Men Are Punished
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 2The Army, completing its administrative measures in connection with the Mylai killings four years ago, formally reprimanded a colonel and a captain today and ordered a sergeant ousted from the service.

title: ARE MAJOR WINS TITLE IN SHOOTING
description: MUNICH, West Germany, Sept. 2 (UPI)  Army Major Lones Wigger of Columbus, Ga., won the Olympic free rifle shooting gold medal today, hair's breadth ahead of Boris Melnik of the Soviet Union.

title: Religion
description: The intercession by a powerful Cardinal of the American Catholic Church has temporarily brought to a halt movement to alter the church's traditional stand on divorce and remarriage.Nowhere has the marriage ceremony phrase, until death do you part, had a more literal meaning than in the Catholic Church. From its earliest days, Catholicism has held that a lawful, consummated marriage between baptized man and a baptized women is for life, and that even in cases where civil divorce occurs, the original marriage bond persists.

title: The Nation
description: DETROITEverything is going up: groceries, taxes, rentbut not prices for new cars. At least not now. Last week the Price Commission denied increases to General Motors Corporation and the Ford Motor Company, the two biggest car makers, saying their profits might be too high if prices went up. But the Commission said they could ask again in October, which could mean approval in November.

title: Rock Festival Crowd Blocks Indiana Road
description: EVANSVILLE, Ind., Sept. 2 (AP)Vehicles on the way to a rock festival on Bull Island jammed roads in the area today, blocking Interstate 64 from Grayville, Ill., to Highway 41, about 25 miles north of here.

title: Son to the Kanners
description: BALTIMORE, Sept. 2A Son was born on Aug. 27 to Dr. and Mrs. Steven R. Kanner at the Washington Hospital Center. The child, whose father is a resident physician at Baltimore City Hospital, has been named Benjamin Todd.

title: Winter Won't Chill Amateur Tennis
description: The emergence of professional tennis as a glamour sport has been paralleled by the amateur game across the country. In the metropolitan area, tennis is now a yearround sport. description: ANAHEIM, Sept. 2. (AP) Rudy May stopped the Baltimore Orioles on three hits tonight and Bob Oliver hit tworun homer to give the California Angels a 20 victory.

description: To the Editor: To put peaceful pressure on Greece to move away from military dictatorship would be the ultimate arrogance of power, according to Secretary of State Rogers. To kill, maim and injure hundreds of thousands of helpless Vietnamese by bombing, on the other hand, is presumably not arrogant, indeed perhaps just the ultimate humanity of beneficent power (in Mr. Rogers world). Here, laid bare, is evidence of the keen observation made by Solzhenitsyn in his Nobel lecture (news story Aug. 25):

Farrell Fitch Bride Of William Cosmas

The Rev. Joseph Fraccaro of the First Congregational Church here performed the ceremony.

title: New Orders by Thieu Extends Death Penalty
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Monday, Sept. 4 (AP)President Nguyan Van Thieu has ordered the death penalty for hijacking, armed robbery and rape and has suspended military justice, the official Government press agency announced today.

title: SINGAPORE PARTY HAILS ITS SWEEP
description: SINGAPORE, Monday, Sept. 4Lee Kuan Yew's ruling Peoples Action party held victory celebrations yesterday after its clean sweep in Saturday's general election.

title: Hailwood Wins Auto Race
description: SALZBURG, Austria, Sept. (AP)Mike Hailwood of Britain won the Formula Two car race for the Salzburg Festival prize today and increased his lead In the European Formula Two championship to 46 points.

title: VENICE FESTIVAL HONORS CHAPLIN
description: VENICE, Italy, Sept. 3Are festivals still useful? inquires a questionnaire of the guests at Venice 33, the 1972. Venice Film Festival. The answer seems to be yes in general, with reservations. During the last 15 days, more than 100 films have been projected in the.Lido Cinema Palace. The programs have been overstuffed, and no one was, quite sure how they were chosen.

title: Trudy Svala Is Bride of Physician
description: DELAWARE, Ohio, Sept. 3Miss Trudy Brits Maria Svala was married here this afternoon in the home of her parents, Mr. and Mrs. C. Gunnar Svala, to Dr. Richard L. Berkowitz, son of Dr. and Mrs: Sidney S. Berkowitz of New York Rabbi Gerald Goldman of Ann Arbor Mich., and the Rev., David Ullery of All Saints Lutheran Church in Worthington officiated.

title: Houk, MacPhait Are Rehired By Yanks Through 75 Season
description: Ralph Houk, as field manager, and Lee MacPhail, as executive vice president and general manager, were rehired by the New York Yankees yesterday, ending speculation about possible changes.. The speculation had pretty much died of its own, weight since the Yankees get involved in the pennant race, even though no formal action was taken until, this weekend.

title: London: Nostalgia and Experiment
description: LONDONOnce a year, as regular as clockwork, the Lords and Commons amuse themselves with discussing whether the masses care for high art... these annual discussions are innocent enough but somewhat superfluous inasmuch as the point at issue was settled some years since by private enterprise in the East End of London. The editorial, from The Pall Mall Gazette in 1886, plainly referred to the series of art exhibitions held annually in the East End since 1881 by Canon Samuel Augustus Barnett, vicar of Whitechapel. The exhibitions grew out of a suggestion by friends that the vicar and his wife should show their neighbors  mostly immigrants from eastern Europe  some of the art works they had brought back from a visit to Egypt.

title: Tool Makers Map a Battle Campaign
description: The war room back in Cincinnati has been disbanded. The battle is about to begin. How successful the planning has been will come out over the next 11 days, the duration of the 1972 International Machine Tool Show in Chicago, which opens tomorrow.

title: Music:Durable Carmen
description: Carmen, a perennial breadandbutter staple of the operatic repertory, will be very much with us during the fall season. A good deal of curiosity has already been generated by the forthcoming Metropolitan production conceived by the late Goeran Gentele, while the City Opera has planned eight performances of its current mounting that was first unveiled just a year ago.

title: TROOPS IN ULSTER BATTLE IN ERROR
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Sept. 3A British soldier was shot dead and another seriously injured when two army patrols mistook each other for terrorists and opened fire early today.

title: Labor Day Resolutions
description: How did people ever get into the habit of selecting that artificial calendar day called New Year's to make resolutions for improving the quality of their lives? Everyone knows that this season, the end of the vacations, the return to life's routine, brings the best mood for making resolutions.

title: ABROAD AT HOME
description: A man in upstate New York, concerned about American planes bombing the dikes in North Vietnam, wrote a letter recently to President Nixon. He got an answer from the Acting Assistant Secretary of State for Public Affairs, John Richardson Jr. As an example of contemporary official logic it deserves a wider audience.

title: $1.5Million in Bogus Bills Seized
description: SPRINGFIELD, Mass., Sept. 3 (AP)Five persons have been arrested and charged with counterfeiting and the authorities have seized $1.5million in bogus money.

title: Hawaii Fishing CoOp, Caught in Fight Over Land, Loses Antipoverty Funds
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Sept. 3 While Thomas H. Mercer explained the decision not to continue funding the fishermen's cooperative out there across the Pacific, patterns of sun and cloud flashed across the windows, products of afternoon fog scudding across Nob Hill from the Golden Gate.

title: WILLIAM J. M'QUADE, POLICE OFFICIAL, 66
description: William J. McQuade, who was Chief of Staff of the Police Department at his retirement in 1966, died in his sleep yesterday at his home, 6479 83d Place, Middle Village, Queens. He was 66 years old.

title: U.S. RETAINS RULES ON TOMATO IMPORTS
description: WASHINGTON, Sept, 3 (AP) The Department of Agriculture has decided to retain a controversial marketing order for Florida tomatoes that consumer spokesmen say forces hard, chemically treated green fruit onto consumers at high prices.

title: Roundup:.004 Separates 4 Clubs in American East
description: Baltimore, Boston, New York and Detroit were locked in the American League Eastern Division race, separated by a halfgame on Labor Day. No major league race involving so many teams has been so close so late in the season.

title: Books of The Times
description: The great chess match, between Bobby Fischer and Boris Spassky was over, and suddenly the afternoons wer empty. But I was not going to sit around displaying my withdrawal symptoms to an empty television screen (Shelby Lyman, where arty. you?) No, what I was going to do, Was plunge straight into reading chess instead of watching it, and I don't mean those in structional books filled with little diagrams that make you shout at the dog. What I mean is a sort of new idea that came to me a few weeks ago just about the time I found myself staring at the 64 squares of Edmund Wilson's To the Finland Station and wondering if Lenin could get to Russia without eXposing his Marx to attack by the Czar's knights. I mean stories that use the logic of chess to unfold their plots. After all, I thought, trying to shake the squares from my head, there's Lewis Carroll's Through the ,Looking Glass and Vladimir Nabokov's The Defense. So perhaps if I dug a little, I'd find others.

title: New MexicanAmerican Party Hails Growth of Brown Power
EQUATION TAKES 4 SAILING HONORS
description: STAMFORD, Conn., Sept. 3John T. Potter's Equation won the Vineyard Trophy and three other special prizes today in sweeping available honors on the Stamford Yacht Club's weatherwhipped 38th annual Vineyard race.

title: PANEL FOR M'GOVERN ORGANIZED IN CHILE
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Sept. 3 (UPI)A handful of United States citizens living in this Socialist country have formed a McGovern for President committee and feel that Senator George McGovern will easily carry the American absentee vote here.

title: Ellen Miriam Semenoff Married
description: PAWTUCKET, R.I, Sept 3Miss Ellen Miriam Semenoff and David Mark Silberman, who were graduated in June from Brandeis University and who will be attending the Harvard Law School in the fall, were married here today at the home of the bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Ralph P. Semenoff.

title: Letters tog the Editor
description: To the. Editor: Lucian K. Truscott 4th's comments on the West Point Honor Code (OpEd Aug. 19) left me with a sense of frustratio4 and anguish. The standard has surely fallen if an attack on a code of conduct as venerable as this can go unchallenged ,and if remarks as irrelevant and as unsubstantial as his can serve as adequate rebuttal to countless lives of honor and integrity

title: 200,000 Rock Fans Flock to a Festival On Isle in Wabash
description: CARME, Ill., Sept. 3 (UPI) An estimated 200,000 young persons jammed Bull Island in the Wabash River today as rock groups performed on a makeshift wooden stage.

title: SHOP TALK
description: It used to be that jewelry was an accessory to a dress; for those who wear Jules Parker's new creations, the dress is merely an incidental background, and the more innocuous it is, the better. Mr. Parker has designed dramatic collarboneiowaistlength bibs that are carpets of peacock or pheasant feathers suspended from strands of beads.

title: 47 Soviet Jews Petition Podgorny on Exit Taxes
description: MOSCOW, Sept. 3A protest campaign against new emigration taxes gained impetus here over the weekend with letter, by 47 Soviet Jews to President Nikolai V. Podgorny terming the high exit fees for edudated emigrants unconstitutional and arbitrary.

title: Susan Elmer Has Nuptials
description: JENKINTOWN, Pa., Sept. 3 Miss Susan Gaye Elmer, daughter of Mr. and Mis. Walter Elmer of Ambler, was married at the Abington Friends Meeting here this afternoon to Norman Richard Weiss, son of Dr. and Mrs. Louis Weiss of New York. The ceremony was performed according tothe rites of the Society of Friends.

title: Bronx GentilityLostin Modern Bustle
description: Seymour Escava, one the owners of the Nadeen clothing store at Third Avenue and 152d Street in the Bronx, was outraged the other day to see a street peddler nonchalantly spreading out his clothing wares on the sidewalk directly in front of his store.

title: Land Boom, Now $6Billion Industry, Often Exploits Gullible City Dweller
description: LAKE POCONO, Pa., Sept. 3 Camelot is right here in the forested Pocono Mountains, as anyone who drives through the maze of billboards along Route 940 can plainly see.

title: HERNE'S HORSE FAIRFIELD WINNER
description: NEW CANAAN, Conn.,, Sept. 3Bobi Herfield's King William Henry I became the ruler of the regular working hunter division at the Fairfield Bridal Path Association Horse Show today.

title: Esther Rosenman Is Married on L.I.
description: ROCKVILLE CENTRE, L. I., Sept. 3  The marriage of Miss Esther Zeva Roseman, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Yehuda J. Rosenman, to Richard Alan Hochman, son of Mr. and Mrs. Aaron Hochman of Arlington, Va., took place here today in the Lincoln Square Synagogue. Rabbis Gerson Winer, Meyer Siegel and Stanley Siegel officiated.

title: TOUR OF FAR EAST SET BY SYMPHONY
description: PITTSBURGH, Sept. 3The Pittsburgh Symphony Orchestra will make its first tour of the Far East in April, with performances scheduled for Japan and Korea. A highlight of the tour will be three concerts April 10, 11, 12.at the Osaka Music Festival in Japan.

title: DR. HYMAN CHERNOFF
description: NEW HAVEN, Sept. 3Dr. Hyman M. Chernoff, director of the department of electrocardiology at the Yale New Haven Hospital and associate professor of clinical medicine at Yale, died Thursday of a heart attack in Glens Falls (N.Y.) Hospital. He was 54 years old and lived here.

title: U.S. Officials Say China Widens African Aid to Extend Influence
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 3China has negotiated or renewed aid and trade agreements with 24 African countries in the last two years, closely following the resumption of active diplomacy after the Isolation of the Cultural Revolution in the late nineteensixties.

title: Mets Run in 9th Beats Astros, 21
description: HOUSTON, Sept. 3  Any resemblance between the Mets who rallied for 11 runs in the last two innings of Saturday night's game to beat the Astros, 118, and the New York club that faced Houston this afternoon was almost inconceivable.

title: 2 Die, 44 Are Hurt As Bus Plummets Off Richmond Road
description: RICHMOND, Sept. 3 (AP)An elderly woman and a teenage girl were killed early today when a southbound Greyhound bus plunged 35 feet off a highway overpass and landed upside down near a hotel parking lot, the authorities said. The 44 other persons aboard the bus were reported injured.

title: Art Show Aims to Make City Understandable
description: Some are serious and some are frivolous but all the exhibits have the same goal "Making New York Understandable.

title: Voting Is Light in Cambodia In National Assembly Race
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Sept. 3 (UPI)Cambodia's first National Assembly election in six years opened today with teams of Government workers moving from house to house asking citizens to vote. Military planes dropped thousands of leaflets on the capital urging that citizens go to the polls.

title: PICKUP EXPECTED IN STEEL ACTIVITY
description: PITTSBURGH, Sept. 3The easy days of summer are over for the steel industry when the Labor Day weekend ends.

title: Massachusetts Isles Cut Off
description: BOSTON, Sept. 3 (UPI)Thousands of seasonal residents and holiday visitors were stranded today on the islands of Nantucket and Martha's Vineyard when steamship service to the Massachusetts mainland was canceled because of 60mileanhour winds and rough seas accompanying the tropical storm Carrie.

title: Car Kills Manhattan Man
description: WESTHAMPTON BEACH, L. I., Sept. 3  Leonard J. Scheer, 37 years old, of 315 East 72d Street, Manhattan, was killed today when his car went out of control on Jessup Lane and was struck by another car. The driver of the other car, identified by the police as Grazna Zalowski, 19, of New Britain, Conn., was not injured.

title: City Gets an O.E.O Grant To Assist Ethnic Groups
description: A $250,000 Federal Office of Economic Opportunity grant has been made to the city administration to help the poor in ethnic groups outside the largely black and Puerto Rican official poverty areas.

title: Spook in Party Role Urges Local Control of Industry
description: WASKINGTON, Sept. 3 (UPI) Dr. Benjamin Spock, Presidential candidate of the small, leftwing People's party, called today for local control of industry by those who work in the plants and those who live in the communities the plants serve.

title: German Merited Comrades Arrive and Depart in Shifts
description: MUNICH, West Germany, Sept. 3 (UPI)The first group of about 1,000 merited comrades from East Germany had to return home at the halfway stage of the Olympics to allow the next group to attend the second week of the Games.

title: Their House Is Ugly in a Charming Way
description: GREAT BARRINGTON, MassStephen and Virginia Glauber's weekend home stands in a meadow of tall grasses about 10 miles south of here, looking for all the world like a cube gone wild. It is.

title: WCLUSKEY WINS IN CALIFORNIA 500
description: ONTARIO, Calif., Sept. 3Roger McCluskey today won the California 500, a Southern California happening that was marred by freakish incidents, interrupted two hours by rain, enlivened by rhubarbs and started by the President's daughter, Mrs. Tricia Nixon Cox.

title: Red Smith
description: MUNICH; West Germany, Sept. 3Timothy Lee Dement is a 17yearold schoolboy from Bossier City, La., who weighs 113 pounds. When he made the Olympic team as a flyweight, a razor manufacturer presented free samples to all the American gladiators. Tim gave his to his sister to shave her legs. Today swinging right hands flung persistently by a tiny Colombian catamount named Calixto Perez kept bouncing off the downy Dement visage and

title: Prison Riot in North India
description: GAYA, India, Sept. 3 (Reuters)One prisoner was killed and 55 were injured during a jail riot in this northern Indian city today, officials said. Two magistrates and 70 policemen were also injured. Policemen opened fire to subdue prisoners throwing stones. Many of the prisoners had climbed onto the roof of the jail in protest against a cut in rations and alleged assaults on them by the prison staff, the officials said.

title: A's Coach to Retire
description: OAKLAND, Sept. 3 (AP)The retirement of Bill Posedel, 66 years old, as Oakland Athletics pitching coach at the close of the 1972 season was announced today by the team owner, Charles O. Finley.

title: Polaroid Pocket Camera To Miss Christmas Sales
description: The Polaroid Corporation has announced that its new pocketsized instant color camera will not be ready for national introduction by Christmas, the target previously set.

title: Patricia Daly Becomes Bride
description: SUDBURY Mass., Sept. 3Patricia Mary Daly, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. William Daly of Natick, was married here this afternoon to Carl Stewart Werne, son of Mrs. Jabob Werne of Jamaica, Queens, New York, and; the late. Dr. Werne.

title: Israel Asked to Pay
description: TEL AVIV, Sept. 3  Dr. Nahum Goldmann, the controversial president of the World Jewish Congress, created a stir this weekend with a suggestion that Israel should raise money to pay the high levies demanded by the Soviet Government from educated Jews wishing to come to Israel. In an interview with the Israeli radio from Paris, he urged that Israel raise international loans and contributions.

title: Tanaka Back in Tokyo
description: TOKYO, Sept. 3 (AP)Premier Kakuei Tanaka returned today from talks in Hawaii with President Nixon and said that United StatesJapanese relations have now entered a new era.

title: Bridge: Weissman's Team Scores Upsets in Tournament Here
description: New York's Knickerbocker tournament concludes today, at the New York Hilton. The knockout teams finished yesterday in a roundrobin final between three New York teams captained by B. Jay Becker, Peter Weichsel and Jerome Weissman.

title: NIXON HELD LIKELY TO DROP PROGRAM OF MINORITY JOBS
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 3The Nixon Administration has decided to scrap the Philadelphia Plan, according to sources in the Labor Department and the White House.

title: 2 of 3 Pilots Hanoi Is Freeing Said to Assail War
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Sept. 3 (Agence FrancePresse)  Two of the three American pilots who are to be released from North Vietnamese prisons have purportedly issued antiwar statements and an appeal to the American people and Congress to take firm, positive action to end the fighting.

title: State Plans Stronger Campaign To Curb Cigarette Bootlegging
description: A stepped up campaign against cigarette bootleggers, who are costing New York State $50million a year in uncollected excise taxes and additional millions in sales taxes, is planned by the State Division of Taxation.

title: With a Parent in a Nursing Home,Offspring Need to Express Their Emotions
description: The building on East 79th Street could be any of the high rise, highrent apartment hottses between Third and Lexington Avenues except that on the sidewalk in front of No. 211 fraillookingold nien and women lean against a, low wall or sit in wheel chairs.

title: The Bronx Had Everything, Including Own Shows
description: E. H. Sothern and Julia Marlowe, David Warfield, the Barrymores, Benny Leonard, the 1961 Presidential election, the first subway series.

title: PRESIDENT SCORES WELFARE ETHIC
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., Sept. 3President Nixon assailed today those who, he said, espoused policies that would threaten fundamental American valuesmost particularly what he called the work ethic"and thereby weaken the American character.

title: Kidnapping Scare Brings Mob Killings in Nigeria
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, Sept. 3The fear that children will be kidnapped and either sold into slavery or used in sacrificial killings continues to spread in Nigeria often with tragic results.

title: Blind Group Scores 2 Agencies of State During Parley Here
description: Though some were guided by canes or seeingeye dogs, friends recognized each other from a word or two overheard across the big room at the state convention of the National Federation of the Blind at the McAlpin Hotel yesterday.

title: Edward Churchill Found Dead; Boston Surgeon and Professor
description: STRAFFORD, Vt., Sept. 3 The body of Dr. Edward D. Churchill, the thoracic and cardiac surgeon who had headed general surgical services at Massachusetts General Hospital and had been professor of surgery at Harvard University, was found yesterday on the periphery of his treefarm estate here. Dr. Churchill was 76 years old and also lived in Belmont, Mass.

title: Italians and Greeks Trade Charges of Meddling
description: ROME, Sept. 3  Relations between Italy and Greece are worsening with charges of subversive meddling in each other's affairs being flung back and forth.

title: DR. DAVID JEDWABNIK
description: Dr. David F. Jedwabnik, who was director of the Hospital for Chest Diseases in Vilna, then part of Poland, from 1925 until his escape early in World War II, died yesterday at his home, 130 West 57th Street. He was 83 years old and had lived here since 1939.

title: Women Call for Bigger Voice in Labor Movement
description: WASHINGTON, Sept, 3 A coalition of women's rights organizations today urged George Meany, the A.F.L.C.I.O. president, to use his influence to help expand and upgrade the role of women in leadership of the American labor movement.

title: Personal Finance: HomeSales Fees
description: The closing costs associated with buying or selling a home are so high in many areas of the country today that the Department of Housing and Urban Development, acting under Congressional authority, is planning to set maximum allowable fees.

title: Letters tog the Editor
description: To the Editor: Some corrective ought to be applied to Jefferson B. Fordham's statement of moral outrage over Vietnam (letter, Aug. 23). It is never pleasant to take issue with an expression of sincere and high moral concern, even when as in.the present case it does smack bit of a certain moral arrogance and moral distortion.

title: Storm Veers North, Just Glazing the City
description: All things considered, New York City came off pretty well yesterday.

title: French Socialist Rebuked
description: PARIS, Sept. 3The Soviet Ambassador to France has rejected charges by a top French Socialist leader of Soviet discrimination against Jews and intervention in Czechoslovakia.

title: Back to Palestine
description: The Arab villages of Berem and Ikrit are not easy find on a modern map of Palestine and they are even harder to locate on the ground, for in common with many other old Arab settlements they have been bulldozed away by the construction of modem. Israel. These two villages now epitomize a crisis of conscience among Israelis on an issue where comfortable consensus has long reigned.

title: Theater: In the Streets
description: From Philharmonic Hall to the New York State Theater, the plaza at Lincoln Center was filled with some 1,500 people yesterday for the. last day of the twoweek Community/Street Theater Festival. This was the largest audience of the festival.

title: Tentam, Droll Role Top Belmont Field In Governor Stakes
description: Droll Role, who has not started a race since July. 29 at Aqueduct when he won the Tidal Handicap on grass, will seek his fourth stakes victory in his last five outings today in the $119,600 Governor Stakes at Belmont Park. A Labor Day crowd of more than 50,000 is expected.

title: Smoke From Cuban Cigars Wafts Freely in Canada
description: TORONTO, Sept. 3 If the cigar smokers among the estimated 200,000 American tourists visiting Toronto this summer don't know real Cuban cigars are sold in Canada, they might guess it from an unusual downtown billboard in full view everyone driving off the thruway from Buffalo.

title: U.S. TO INTENSIFY MANILA DRUG WAR
description: MANILA, Sept. 3The United States is acting to combat the increasing activity of interInational heroin traffickers in the Philippines.

title: White Sox Stop Yankees By50
description: The Yankees' eightyear march along the road back was slowed yesterday when they lost a 50 decision to the Chicago White Sox and Wilbur Wood, the lefthanded plumber and lobster pot tender from Maine.

title: Strip Mining and an Ohio Town: Economy vs. the Environment
description: BARNESVILLE, Ohio, Sept. 3The Gem of Egypt never sleeps. Driving along Interstate 70 in the deep of the night, you suddenly see it looming 170 feet in the air, its lights glowing as it turns slowly like some prehistoric monster grazing while humanity sleeps. But topsoil and vegetation are mere roughage for this giant earth mover (gem) that patrols the Egypt Valley. Its real appetite is for coal, millions of tons of it, buried as deep as 100 feet under the rolling hills of Belmont County.

title: Riegel's Deft Alfredo Colors Traviata
description: As regularly as the seasons change, some expert writes a lament about the scarcity of good operatic tenors. You can't very easily go wrong In that, either; such voices are always in short supply. Some baritones and basses even halfjokingly insist that the tenor throat is an unnatural phenomenon. But it is best to stay out of that debate.

title: Letters tog the Editor
description: To the Editor: Regarding your Aug. 12 editorial Bringing Back Brodway, I fear that in oversimplifying the conditions that have brought about the seminightmare status, of the Broadway area afterhours (or even during the day), you have indulged more in myth than in ,fact.

title: LAYER IS PRESSED TO DEFEAT FILLOL
description: Just when it looked as if Rod Laver was going to join Ken Rosewall as an early round upset victim in the United States Open tennis championships at, Forest Hills, Queens, the Rocket roared back yesterday to defeat Jaime Fillol of Chile, 62, 46, 67, 61, 76.

title: Rhodesia Tobacco Auction Is Said to Be Near Collapse
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 3 (UPI) Sources in the Department of Agriculture have reported that freeauction, burleytobacco sales in Rhodesia are on the verge of collapse.

title: PATROLMAN IS HURT FIGHTING 2 YOUTHS
description: An offduty patrolman suffered a fractured skull when struck with a hatchet early yesterday in a fight with two teenagers after they forced his car to stop, authorities reported.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Thank you for your fine reporting on World Chess championship in this Year of the Chess. We, the chess fans allover the world, would like to see this chess informational revolution continue at least through the World Chess Olympiade which will open next month in Skopje, Yugoslavia.

title: Markets Closed Today
description: Securities and commodities exchanges in the United States and Canada will be closed today in observance of Labor Day. Banks and governmental offices and most businesses will also be closed for the holiday. Overseas exchanges will for the most part observe regular trading hours.

title: Letters tog the Editor
description: To the Editor: T. Jordan Kunik's astonishing OpEd article Aug. 26 on the depressing Grand Central Terminal will, I hope, inspire rebuttal of the rather chilling thrust of his argument. What spirit, asks Mr. Kunik. Who is responsive to that spirit?

title: A Plague on Both Your Tribes
description: The ArabIsraeli quarrel is developing into a monumental bore. While East and West Europeans, North and South Koreans, Indians and Pakistanis, American and Russians, Chinese and Japanese are all rapidly patching up their differences, the Arabs and Israelis, acting like adolescents, refuse to resolve their wasteful 25yearold brawl.

title: A Replay Precedes Fischer's Crowning
description: REYKJAVIK, Iceland, Sept. 3 Bobby Fischer, following his normal routine, showed up almost an hour late tonight for the ceremony at which he was crowned chess champion of the world. Just before the ceremony, he and Boris Spassky, the man he dethroned, played over the final position of the final game of their match.

title: Susan Frank Married to Jared Stamell
description: Miss Susan Barbara Frank and Jared Bennett Stamen were married here yesterday evening in the Terrace Room of the Plaza by Rabbi Murray Kohn.

title: Miss Curley Bride Of David Rierner
description: CHEVY CHASE, Md., Sept. 3Miss Deirdre Ellen Curley, daughter of Prof. and Mrs:. Daniel Curley of Urbana III., was married here this afternoon to David Raphael Riemer, son of Prof. and Mrs. Neal Riemer of Madison, N.J.

title: Teacher Union Warns of Strike Unless City Offers Pact Today
description: Board of Education negotiators sought yesterday to put together a total contract package acceptable to. the United Federation of Teachers, which has threatened to strike next Monday, the opening day of the new school year.

title: Leipzig Trade Fair Opens
description: BERLIN, Sept. 3 (UPI)The Leipzig International Trade Fair opened today with the participation of 6,500 exhibitors from 51 countries, including the United States, the East German news agency said. Aside from consumer goods, products of the chemical, textile, machinery, machine building and plastics industries are also on display.

title: 2,752 Contracts Awarded
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 3 (AP) State highway departments awarded 2,752 Federally aided highway and bridge construction contracts worth $2.5billion in the first six months of 1972, the Federal Highway Administration said today.

title: Father's Days
description: Not too long ago, my infant daughter discovered her hand. With great concentration she studied it, sometimes holding it so close to her nose that her eyes crossed. She also took it and aimed it in the general direction of her mouth. Often she bumped her nose, her cheek, but as the days went on, she developed confidence.

title: MORTON CLEARED OF TOTAL BLAME
description: KANSAS CITY, Sept. 2Did the Dallas Cowboys let Craig Morton down, or did he let them down here last night as the Kansas City Chiefs snapped the Super Bowl champions winning streak at 15 by winning easily, 2010? The Chiefs had poise and power, playing before a crowd of 79,592 in the new Arrowhead Stadium two weeks before the opening of the National Football League season.

title: Sifford and Johnston, on 201's, Share Lead in Hartford Golf
WORLDWIDE UNITY URGED FOR BLACKS
description: SAN DIEGO, Sept. 3A call for a political alliance of the world's 600 million Negroes was greeted today by a swelling chant of Umoja Mweusi Swahili for black unity among 2,500 militants attending the second International Conggress of Africa People.

title: THOMAS A. WILSON, UPSTATE MAYOR, 83
description: BINGHAMTON, N.Y., Sept 3 Thomas A. Wilson, a former Mayor of Binghamton and president of Marine Midland Trust Company of Southern New York, died in a hospital here yesterday. He was 83 years old.

title: Spitz Captures Record 6th Gold Medal
description: MUNICH, West Germany, Sept. 3Mark Spitz won his sixth gold medal of the current Olympics tonight, the first athlete to achieve such success in the history of the modern Games.

title: Wall Kills Man as River Floods New Mexico Town
description: HILLSBORO, N. M. Sept. 3 (UPI)The rainswollen Perchas River swept through the foothills of southwest New Mexico today, flooding at least one small community. One person was killed and seven were missing.

title: Dr. Herman Hofmann, Led Westchester Palsy Group
description: LARCHMONT, N.Y., Sept. 3 Dr. Herman G. Hofmann, a physician, died today at the New Rochelle Hospital Medical Center. He was 62 years old and lived at 1 Rock Hill Terrace.

title: Most Concerns Find Curbs No Hindrance for Profits
description: Most businessmen and economists say that they are unconcerned about the Nixon Administration's controls on profit margins, even though the Price Commission has taken action against 42 companies for violations of such controls, dozens more pricerollback orders are pending and hundreds more could be issued by the end of the year.

title: Mrs. Blanche Nirenstein, Official of Mizrachi, 87
description: Mrs. Blanche Cohen Schlang Nirenstein, founder and past president of the Manhattan chapter of the Mizrachi Women's Organization, died yesterday in Doctors Hospital. She was 87 years old and lived at 51 West 86th Street.

title: Harassment by Leftists in Japan Vexes U.S. Forces
description: TOKYO, Sept. 3Several seemingly trivial incidents in which Japanese leftists stopped the movement of American militarr tanks here have caused American authorities to become noticeably impatient with the continued harassment and the apparent reluctance of the Japanese Government to provide the protection that would allow American forces to move equipment unimpeded.

title: Light on Abortion
description: The fact that the emotionfilled debate over abortion in New York State is far from over, makes particularly valuable the statistical analysis of the 1971 experience just released by the state's Department of Health. Both sides in the debate will have to take account of the rich supply of data now available about the first full calendar year of legal abortion in this state.

title: Meant the FenceSitter
description: Ever since Franklin D. Roosevelt instructed his lieutenants at the 1944 Democratic National Convention in Chicago to clear it with Sidney, organized labor has been a consequential mobilizer of political manpower and money in every Presidential campaign, always on the Democratic side. This year, with the union legions badly split and George Meany peevishly vowing to pull down no lever on his Presidential ballot Nov. 7, the centralized political machinery that has been the mainspring of labor's influence in governmental affairs is in danger of emerging permanently weakened, perhaps shattered.

title: Union Members Broaden Their Vistas at Labor College Here
description: Union leaders and members seeking to improve their skills, broaden their educations and earn an associate or bachelor's degree have been signing a new kind of contract at the Labor Division of Empire State College here.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: State Controller Arthur Levitt said yesterday that the state and city Commissioners of Social Services had taken positive steps to improve the city's administration welfare. In a statement, Mr. Levitt said the welfare problem here was the greatest of its kind in the nation, compounded by the influx of new residents and by. the tensions metropolitan life.

title: 2 Months After Simla
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, Sept. 3Two months ago, Prime Minister Indira Gandhi of India and President Zulfikar Ali Bhutto of Pakistan came down the mountain from Simla with a plan for, lasting peace on the subcontinent and more hope of achieving it than at any time since the British left the two countries independent and squabbling 25 years ago. Now, as the two countries move toward carrying out the first phase of the Simla accord, two third partiesBangladesh and Chinahave cast a pall over the chances for peace. the two countries independent and squabbling 25 years ago. Now, as the two countries move to ward carrying out the first phase of the Simla accord, two third partiesBangladesh and Chinahave cast a pall over the chances for peace.

title: Barbara Evans Bride of John Kinnear 3d.
description: ROLLING HILLS ESTATES, Calif., Sept. 3Miss Barbara Lynn Evans of Manhattan Beach, daughter of Mrs.. Thomas H. Law of Fort Worth, Tex., and Richard E. Evans of Rolling Hills Estates, Was marriedhere this afternoon to John Charles Kinnear 3d, also of Manhattan Beach. His parents are Mr. and Mrs. Kinnear Jr. of New Canaan, Conn.

title: Lettuce Boycott Shows Signs of Gaining After Lagging for Its First Three Months
description: Cesar Chavez's nationwide consumer boycott of lettuce appears to have ralliedlittle effective support in the three months since it started, but there is evidence that it: may now be gaining some momentum.

title: WNET Is Considering Weekly Chess Series
description: Channel 13's daily recreating of the FischerSpassky chess match proved so popular that the public television station is negotiating tc present a weekly chess series starring Shelby Lyman, the master who has become famous as a TV performer as well as a chess player.

title: Personalities at Olympics: AkiiBua the Best in Vest
description: John AkiiBua, the newly crowned Olympic 400 meter hurdles champion and world recordbreaker, did his training in the Mountains of the Moon in Uganda running uphill wearing a vest containing 25 pounds in lead weights.

title: Letters tog the Editor
description: To the Editor: Civil Service Conimissioner Harry I. Bronstein apparently did not understand your recent editorial relating to the dumbbell test failed by two Hunter College women who passed all other aspects of the test The Commissioner, in his letter replying to the editorial, is disturbed that the editorial aided in undermining the merit system whereas in fact it pleaded for more relevant tests in order to prevent discrediting the merit system.

title: Making Old Age Secure
description: Danger signals are up this Labor Day for the pension plans in which millions of American workers pin a major part of their hope for oldage security.

title: Syrian Seen Mediator In MoscowCairo Rift
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Sept. 3A message received yesterday by President Hafez alAssad of Syria from President Anwar elSadat of Egypt has heightened speculation in diplomatic quarters here about a mediation effort by General Assad designed to check the deterioration in EgyptianSoviet relations.

title: Team Canada's Breakfast: Humble Pie
description: TORONTO, Sept. 3  Canada awoke from its bad dream today. But when the people saw the newspapers they realized that last night really happened.

title: Koch Bids U.S. Admit 5,000 Uganda Asians
description: Representative Edward I. Koch, DemccratLiberal of Manhattan, announced yesterday that he had called upon the Nixon Administration to admit 5,000 expelled Asians from Uganda without subjecting them to admission quotas.

title: G.M. to Renew Price Bid After 1973 Cars Are Out
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 3 (Reuter)General Motors will put its 1973 cars on sale later this month at 1972 prices pending a new request for a price increase to the Price Commission, the corporation's chief said today.

title: 18 ATHLETES SAID TO FAIL DRUG TEST
description: MUNICH, West Germany, Sept. 3The tally of athletes accused at the 1972 Summer Olympics of being under influence of drugs rose to 18 today, with an additional suspect on hand.

title: Slow but Steady Progress Reported in Arab Oil Talks
description: BEIRUT, Sept. 3 (UPI)Sixteen days after they began, oil participation talks between Western companies and five Arab nations are making slow but steady progress, conference sources said today.

title: Arrest Tactics a Worry to City Police
description: In the early eighteen hundreds, New York's High Constable, Jacob Hays, evolved an assemblyline technique for nabbing street brawlers. As one police chronicle tells it, He usually knocked off their hats with his staff, and while they were in the act of stooping to pickthem up, he would shove them forward and throw them down, their prostrate bodies generally serving as a barrier to keep the others back...

title: Gas Turbines Get Credit For Keeping City Aglow
description: An aging redbrick building on Brooklyn's Bay Ridge waterfront is the headquarters of relatively new Consolidated Edison generating system that is credited more than anything else this summer with keeping the city from plunging into another power blackout.

title: Historian Tells of SelfConfident China
description: In a country where misery and want were the foundation of the social structure, famine was periodic, death from starvation common, disease pervasive, thievery normal and graft and corruption taken for granted, the elimination of these conditions in China is so striking that negative aspects of the new rule fade in relative importance.

title: Bengals Defeat Browns ,27 to 21; Bills Are Tied, 2424, by Bears
description: Paul Brown returned yesterday to Ohio Stadium at Columbus, where he began his college coaching ca r e e r 31 years ago at Ohio State, and Watched his Cincinnati Bengals beat the Cleveland Browns, 2721, before 84,816. It was the Bengals third preseason victory against two defeats and the Browns fifth straight loss.

title: South Africa Draws U.S. Mining Interest
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Africa, Sept. 3Some of America's largest mining corporationsUnited States Steel, the Phelps Dodge Corporation and Newmont Miningare stepping up their operations in South Africa, and more American companies are entering the South African quest for minerals.

title: Gerstenberg, of G. M., Predicts Record Auto Sales for 1973
description: DETROIT, Sept. 3The General Motors Corporation expects car and truck sales in the United States to climb to record 13.5 million to 14 million next year, up from the 13.2 million expected for 1972, Richard C. Gerstenberg, chairman of G.M., said today.

title: NAMATH'S INJURY IS ONLY A BRUISE
description: The terse message from the Jets locker room after their 93 victory over the Atlanta Falcons in Georgia Tech's Grant Field Saturday said simply that Joe Namath had suffered a slight bruise of his right wrist in the first period.

title: Colombia Nudging Brazil In Economic Leadership
description: BOGOTA, ColombiaThere are two kinds of governments in South America: those chosen by voters and those imposed by the military. Today, the largest countries in both camps Colombia and Brazilare also showing the most impressive economic gains.

title: U.S. Soccer Team Loses Preliminary
description: MEXICO CITY, Sept. 3 (Reuters)Mexico, with a magnificent display of power soccer, beat the United States, 31, today in a preliminary round for the 1974 World Cup.

title: Tractor Cuts Cable
description: BAXTER, Calif., Sept. 3 (UPI) A tractor digging on a construction site was blamed today for briefly distrupting network radio and television reception in several Western states yesterday. It cut a major transcontinental cable, according to an,, American Telephone and Telegraph Company spokesman.

title: Japanese Sale to China
description: TOKYO, Sept. 3A basic agreement has been reached between China and five Japanese steel concerns, including the giant Nippon Steel Corporation, in. Peking on the export of 380,000 tons of Japanese steel to China, according to steel interests here.

title: Labor Leaders Fear Rifts Will Go On After Election
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 3The American trade union movement is deeply divided over politics on Labor Day, 1972, and a growing number of labor leaders are privately voicing fear that these divisions will not easily be healed after Election Day.

title: Viren, a Finn, Gets Up From Knockdown to Win 10,000Meter Run Title and Set World Record
description: MUNICH, West Germany, Sept. 3  With a fancier flourish than ever was used by Paavo Nurmi and Finland's other great Olympic distancerunning champions of yesteryear, the 23yearold Lasse Viren rebounded from the brink of disaster to win the classic 10,000meter title today. Knocked down in a traffic tangle somewhere near the midway mark, the handsome young man with the tightly cropped beard climbed off the deck and set out in pursuit of the leaders 50 yards. ahead. After he caught them he not only went on to score a smashing victory but also set a world record of 27 minutes 38.3 seconds.

title: Leslie Stroh Weds Miss Bingham
description: BILTMORE, N.C., Sept. 3In All Souls Episcopal Church here this afternoon, Miss Kathleen Seymour Bingham, daughter of Mr., and Mrs. Samuel A. Birigham, was married to Leslie Stroh; son of Mrs. Ann Leslie Stroh Of New York and Morris; N.Y., andArthur H. Stroh. The Rev; Cornelius A. Zabriskie performed he ceremony, assisted by the Rev. Isaac N. Northup.

title: Montreal Police Hold Man And Seek 2 in Club Fire
description: MONTREAL, Sept. 3 (AP)The police detained one man and searched for two others today in connected with a fire in the Blue Bird Club, a downtown nightclub, that killed 36 person's and injured 54 on Friday night. About 12 persons were reported in critical condition in Montreal hospitals.

title: Yes Child Labor Is Still a Problem
description: Lewis Hine wrote in 1911: I am sometimes inclined to think that we must mutilate these infants in industry before the shame of it can be driven home. The horror of placing an industrial mortgage upon the back of a perfectly good child does not seem to be obvious.

title: 6 Killed in Illinois Car Crash
description: MOUNT STERLING, Ill., Sept. 3 (UPI)Six persons were killed and four others critically injured today in twocar headon crash on U.S. 24 one and a half miles east of here.

title: Harry Leimbach, Negotiated First Union Pact With A.P.
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., Sept. 3 (AP)  Harry S. Leimbach, who worked in the Washington ioffice of The Associated Press more than 30 years and who was a founder of the United Telegraph Workers, Division 14, died yesterday at the age of 68.

title: Income Reporting Held Misleading
description: Corporations are striving so hard to get immediate income that they sometimes manufacture it, an official of the New York Stock Exchange has charged.

title: Miss Anna Markus Married To Dr. Anthony James Pearce
description: CHATHAM, Mass., Sept. 3 Miss Anna Elizabeth Markus, daughter of Mr. and Mrs'Frits Markus of New York, was married here today to Dr. Anthony James Pearce, son of Mrs. Percy Pearte of Bodmin, England, and the late Captain Pearce of the British, Army.

title: Father, 4 Children. 2 Others Die in Two Syracuse Fires
description: SYRACUSE, Sept. 3 (AP) Two fires here took the lives today of a man and his four children in one dwelling and two youngsters in another. Both fires were under investigation, but fire officials said they did not appear related.

title: Three Dead in Plane Crash
description: NEW BERN, N. C., Sept. 3 (AP)The burned wreckage of a private plane, missing since Friday night with three persons aboard, was found this afternoon in heavy woods two to three miles from the New Bern Airport. There were no survivors. Those on board the Beechcraft Bonanza were listed as the pilot, Kenneth Bello, and his wife, both of White Plains, N. Y., and a passenger whose last name was given as Laurence.

title: JENKINS DEFEATS METS ON 4HITTER
description: Ferguson Jenkins, the tall, talented gentleman from Canada who dabbled in baseball and hockey before he found his niche pitching for the Chicago Cubs, moved within one step of one of baseball's greatest achievements yesterday while his team was splitting a doubleheader with the New York Mets.

title: RAIL FANS GROUP RIDES LINES HERE
description: A national railfan organization that charters trains for day has found that New York is fertile territory.

title: Giants Shift to Upsala; Randy Johnson Drills
description: Randy, Johnson, the quarterback who came out of the JetsGiants 3131 tie on Aug. 18 with a shoulder separation, returned to work yesterday as the Giants moved their camp from Monmouth College in West Long Branch, N. J., to Upsala College in East Orange, N. J. They will move to Yankee Stadium when the Yankees complete their schedule.

title: NAZIS'
description: VIENNA, Sept. 4  Simon Wiesenthal, the man who tracked down Adolf Eichmann, has appealed to the Chilean President, Salvador Allende Gossens, to extradite a German, alleged to be a major war criminal, who has lived in Chile since 1961.

title: Pick a Cooking School and Surprise Friends With a Gourmet Meal
description: AmericaItaly Society, Inc. 22 East 60th Street, N. Y.

title: Administration Denies Intent to Scrap the Philadelphia Plan
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 4The White House and the Labor Department denied today that the Nixon Administration was planning to scrap the Philadelphia Plan, under which Federal construction contractors in Philadelphia have been required to hire certain percentages of workers from minority groups.

title: Tropical Spin Pays $120.40
description: A newcomer to these parts, Robert Wingo of Tampa, Fla., an 18yearold aprentice jockey, introduced himself to the local fans by riding Tropical Spin to victory at a mutuel payoff of $120.40 in the second race. Tropical Spin, a 2yearold colt owned by Lloyd Brinkman, rounded our a daily double of $708.20, set tip by the firstrace victory of Friendly Ways at $11.80.

title: Advertising:
description: A new preliminary prospectus for Carl Ally, Inc., has been issued. It brings some figures up to date since the first one was printed on June 27. The principal news therein is the full year's financial report the 12 months ended June 30, compared with only a 10month report in the original document.

title: Retailers: Boom or PreBoom?
description: Last week, the vice president of one of America's largest departmentstore chains, who earns a substantial salary by, among other duties, attempting to analyze statistics, emitted an audible sigh over the telephone. Retail sales are decidedly up, he conceded, but what we're wondering about is: Are they really booming or just prebooming? His reservation in the face of a recent flurry of high sales figures was not unusual.

title: Warren K. Billings Dead; Figure in 16 Coast Blast
description: REDWOOD CITY, Calif., Sept. 4 (AP)Warren K. Billings, labor organizer imprisoned with Torn Mooney for the 1916 Preparedness Day bombing in an Francisco, died today at hospital here. He was 79 years old.

title: Business Briefs
description: LONDON, Sept. 4 (Reuters) Britain's official reserves rose $9million to $6.09billion in August, the Treasury announced today.

title: RALLY BY VIKINGS BEATS OILERS, 2614
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., Sept 4 (AP)The Minnesota Vikings overcame Dan Pastorini's firsthalf touchdown passes with four Fred Cox field goals and defeated the Houston Oilers, 2614, tonight. Fran Tarkenton came off the benchln the fourth period to help the Viking I rally.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Seymour Siegel [letter, Aug. 25] seems to feel that theology should have no part in his political decision. It would appear that he has succeeded in eliminating theology from his decision from the very fact that he has thrown his support behind President Nixon.

title: GAZA MAYOR ESCAPES ATTEMPT ON HIS LIFE
description: TEL AVIV, Sept. 4The Mayor of Gaza, Rashad Shawa, escaped an assassination attempt today; the Israeli military command said. Three shots were fired and a grenade was thrown at his car but no one was reported injured.

title: POSSUMJET TAKES. $1, 035, 900 RACE
description: RUIDOSO DOWNS, N. M., Sept, 4 (AP)  Possumjet, a chestnut filly owned by Jack Byers of Blanchard, Okia, took a lead midway through the stretch and held on to win by a nose today in the Allmerican QuarterHorse Futurity, the world's richest horse race.

title: Notes on, People
description: Declaring that the living and working conditions of migrant farm workers were Pitifully below standard and totally inadequate Patrick Cardin. al. O'Boyle, the Archbishop of Washington, urged national support for the boycott of iceberg lettuce. Cardinal O'Boyle, often considered a conservative in ecclesiastical and secular matters, said the boycott could help more than two million migrant workers achieve their basic human rights and take their rightful place in the mainstream of American economic life.

title: Dr. Tibor Eckhardt, 84, Dead; A Former Hungarian Diplomat
description: Dr. Tibor Eckhardt, former Hungarian statesman. and diplomat, died here Sunday of heart attack. He was 84 years old and lived at 121East 31st Street.

title: Rough Riders Lose, 1716
description: HAMILTON, Ontario, Sept. 4 (AP)Ian Sunter, soccerstyle kicker, hit a 42yard field goal with 10 seconds left today to give the Hamilton TigerCats 1716 victory over the previously unbeaten Ottawa Rough Riders in a Canadian Football League game.

title: Mrs. McGovern Cites Work on Labor Thesis
RABBI CARDOZO DIES; A SEPHARDIC LEADER
description: Rabbi D. A. Jessurun Cardozo, former assistant minister of the Spanish and Portuguese Synagogue, 8 West. 70th Street, died here Thursday. He was 76 years old and lived at 9963 66th Avenue, Forest Hills, Queens.

title: World Jewish Aides Meet on Soviet Tax
description: LONDON, Sept. 4  World Jewish leaders met here today to try to mobilize international public opinion against the recent tax imposed by the Soviet Union on educated Jews wishing to emigrate to Israel.

title: Jerry Lewis's Telethon Raises Record $9Million
description: The Jerry Lewis Labor Day Telethon for the benefit of the Muscular Dystrophy Associations of American received more than $9million in pledges, a record, during its 20 hours on a coasttocoast television hookup ending at 6:30 P.M. yesterday.

title: Fischer Is Still in Iceland; May Go to Chess Olympics
description: REYKJAVIK, Iceland, Sept. 4 (UPI)  His life's ambition achieved at the age of 29, the world chess champion, Bobby Fischer, relaxed today in Iceland, where he won the crown, and considered a trip to the Chess Olympics in Skopje, Yugoslavia.

title: Colts Trade Dunlap
description: BALTIMORE, Sept. 4, (AP)Leonard Dunlap, secondyear defensive back of the Baltimore Colts, has been traded to the San Diego Chargers for an undisclosed draft choice, the Colts announced today. Dunlap, who was the Colts second firstround draft pick in 1971, sustained a knee injury in the fourth game of 1971 and was forced to sit out the rest of the season.

title: Racialist Overtones Cited
description: GENEVA, Sept. 4The International Commission of Jurists said today that we deplore the racialist overtones in some of the statements by President Idi Amin of Uganda on his expulsion of Asians with, British. passpprts.

title: Work and Play Mix at California Complex
description: NEWPORT BEACH, Calif., Sept. 4If Tom Wolff's office was. in the RCA Building in Manhattan, his home would be about where the J. C. Penney Building is, two blocks away. The TimeLife Building across the street would be the first tee of the golf course. From there he could see the ocean, about as far away as the East River.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: I intend to vote for Hubert H. Humphrey on Nov. 7 as a writein candidate. Don't you wish everyone did?

title: Dole Accuses Democrats of Violations
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 4 (UPI) Senator Robert J. Dole of Kansas, the Republican National Chairman, accused the McGovern campaign today of seven new serious violations of law, including the use of dummy committees to let wealthy contributors avoid paying taxes on their gifts.

title: WEE HARLEY, RESEARCHER, DIES
description: William T. Harley, who played a major role as a researcher of a 19thcentury black community in what is now the BedfordStuyvesant section of Brooklyn, died, of a heart attack Thursday night. He was 73 years old and lived at 129 MacDonough Street in the area.

title: India and Pakistan Fail to Settle Line Of Kashmir Truce
description: NEW DELHI, Sept. 4India and Pakistan announced today that they were unable to meet the deadline for the drawing of a new ceasefire line in Kashmir.

title: Salvation Army Experimenting With Rock
description: It's unlikely that longhaired, modly dressed members of the Salvation Army will soon be playing the Beatles Help instead of The Old Rugged Cross on street corners across the land.

title: India Asks Compassion
description: NEW DELHI, Sept. 4Foreign Minister Swaran Singh said today that in uprooting residents, the Government of Uganda should proceed on considerations of compassion and generosity.

title: HAROLD B. BERKE
description: WESTON, Conn., Sept. 4Harold B. Berke, an estate and tax, laWyer with offices at 51 EaSt 42d Street in New York, died this morning in Norwalk Hospital. His age was 58.

title: Soviet Says the Pentagon Violates ArmsPact Spirit
description: MOSCOW, Sept. 4The Soviet Union accused the Pentagon today of violating the spirit of Soviet American agreements limiting their strategic arsenals and jeopardizing their effectiveness by pressing for accelerated development of new American offensive military systems.

title: RAYMOND ZIMINSKI
description: Raymond Ziminski, manager of M. Schwartz & Son, an importexport concern, and a former linguist in the Foreign Service, died of a heart attack on Sunday at his home, 75 Trenton Avenue, Atlantic Beach, L. I. He was 56 years old.

title: 100 Basques Reported Held After Clashes With Police
description: BILBAO, Spain Sept. 4 (Agence FrancePresse)About 100 people have been detained by the Spanish police following two clashes last week between the Basque separatist group E.T.A. and policemen a reliable source said today.

title: Reporter's Notebook: Reykjavik, Rooks and Russians
description: REYKJAVIK, Iceland, Sept. 4It is now September, and Bobby Fischer has been crowned chess champion of the world, and the sun goes down around 9:30 P.M. In June it was different. Bobby Fischer hadn't arrived, and nobody knew if he would, and it was daylight 24 hours a day in this city near the Arctic Circle.

title: Help Set For U.S.Aided Golf Courses
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 4 (UPI) A Government agency has hired a team of management experts to study and advise about 130 federally financed golf courses on how to, make their operations more profitable.

title: Marquette Cement Elects
description: James E. Poole has been named president and chief executive officer of the Marquette Cement Manufacturing Company by the company's directors, it was announced yesterday.

title: Democrats Here Act to Integrate State and McGovern Campaigns
Sheepshead Bay Thugs Injure Two at Lundy's
description: The manager of the Lundy Brothers seafood restaurant in Sheepshead Bay, Brooklyn, and his son were attacked and robbed there by four holdup men early yesterday.

title: Business Briefs
description: The United States dollar is regaining its status as the major world currency with the least amount of shrinkage in domestic purchasing power, the First National City Bank indicated yesterday.

title: SkyDiver Killed on Coast
description: BREWSTER, Wash., Sept. 4 (UPI)One skydiver drowned, another disappeared and a third was rescued today when they missed their landing area and dropped into the Columbia River during the annual Brewster Air Show. Their names were not immediately released. Sheriff's divers searched the river today for the body of the missing man.

title: U.S. Force in Vietnam Is Now Down to 37,100
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Sept. 4 (Reuters)  United States troop strength in South Vietnam dropped by 600 to reach 37,100 at the end of last week, the American command in Saigon reported today.

title: U.S. PROSECUTORS SPLIT ON BOUNTIES
description: Two United States Attorneys, in adjoining districts here, are taking sharply different stands on the public's role in the prosecution of polluters.

title: CITY TEACHERS CUT SALARY DEMANDS
description: The United Federation of Teachers has made a new salary proposal to the board of Education that substantially reduced its original demand, according to sources close to the school contract talks.

title: U. S. Lines Faced Inquiry
description: Several United States airlines were the subject of a Civil Aeronautics Board investigation last month for allegedly selling tickets on scheduled flights at reduced rates in violation of the board's rules.

title: HOLDUP MAN KILLED POLICEMAN INJURED
description: An alleged holdup man was killed and a second seriously wounded in an exchange of gunfire with an offduty policeman in a Bronx bar and grill early today. The policeman was shot in the forearm.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: I feel very strongly that the recommendation by State Senator John Hughes, chairman of the New YEA State Joint Legislative Committee on: Crime, for the creation by GovernOr Rockefeller of a statewide office of criminal justice, if acted upon, can go a long way toward lessening the ptissibilities of wrongdoing and corruption on the part of police and prosecutors and in the judicial system.

title: Market Place: Another Chapter In Apollo Story
description: Remember Apollo Industries, the deficitridden company whose management was strapped for cash back in 1970? The new management team that came on board in 1968 was looking for a way to solve its $10million shortterm debt problem and it looked to land sales for the answer.

title: Anxiety Over Busing High As Nation's Schools Open
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 4The issue of busing for school desegregation has reached a critical stage in the courts and in Congress as another school year begins.

title: 100 Stranded in Moscow By Aeroflot Overbooking
description: MOSCOW, Sept. 4Aeroflot, the Soviet airline, hi evident eagerness to sell cutrate tickets on regular flights to Americans and other international travelers going via Moscow, overfulfilled its plan and stranded nearly 100 transit passengers this weekend.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: I want to draw attention to the potted trees that are dying for want of water along 5th Avenue, Park Avenue, 57th Street and Broadway. Many have already dropped their leaves.

title: Argonauts Win, 4321
description: MONTREAL, Sept. 4 (AP)Wally Gabler threw four touchdown passes as the Toronto Argonauts won their first Canadian Football League game of the season today, 4321.

title: MRS. IRVING IS JAILED ON REACHING. ZURICH
description: GENEVA, Sept. 4Edith Irving was jailed in Zurich today directly after her arrival from New York to face charges of fraud and forgery for the accomplice role she was alleged to have played in Switzerland in the Howard R. Hughes autobiography hoax.

title: Official Denies Charges
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 4A State Department official today denied Soviet charges of violations in spirit of the Moscow arms agreement, emphasizing that both sides had reserved the right to develop weapons systems pending specific accords on offensive weaponry.

title: Boyle, at U.M.W. Rally, Terms Outsiders'Key Threat to Union
description: GRUNDY, Va., Sept. 4W. A Boyle, seeking reelection as president of the United Mine Workers, made his first political appearance today in the coal fields this year and said that outsiders were the major threat to the union.

title: 30 INJURED AS TRAIN DERAILS IN NEBRASKA
description: INLAND, Neb., Sept. 4 (UPI)  The CaliforniaDenver Zephyr, traveling at 75 miles an hour, derailed near this southcentral Nebraska town early today. Thirty pastengers were injured.

title: The. Education Issue
description: The nation's schools are confronted by problems of enormous pedagogical and, social complexity. The universities lack internal direction and external support. The fiscal foundations of the entire education enterprise are weakened by inflation and taxpayer revolts. New philosophical battles between educational ideologues of left and right once again shake the academic world, while a preoccupied public grows uninterested in the problems and debates of school and campus.

title: BEAR MT AREA PARKS CLOSED FOR SEASON
description: BEAR MOUNTAIN, N.X., Sept. 4All swimming and recreational areas under the jurisdiction of the Palisades Interstate Park Commission closed at sundown today after the worst season in years, caused by excessive rain and heat.

title: Thuy Ties P.O.W. Release To Progress of Paris Talks
description: PARIS, Sept. 4 (Reuters)Xuan Thuy, North Vietnam's chief negotiator of the Paris peace talks, said today that there would be no further release of United States prisoners of war after the forthcoming release of three pilots unless the peace talks showed some definite progress.

title: Bishop James A. McNulty Of Buffalo Is Dead at 72
description: MONTCLAIR, N. J., Sept. 4 (UPI)The Most Rev. James A. McNulty, Roman Catholic Bishop of Buffalo, died here today at St. Vincent's Hospital. He was 72 years old.

title: RICHARD BUCKLEY, LED RADIO CHAIN
description: Richard Dimes Buckley, an owner and operator of radio stations, who most recently headed the Buckley Broadcasting Corporation here, died Saturday on a business trip to San. Francisco. He was. 64 yearS old and lived in Washington; Conn.

title: 1945: OSS officers with Ho and Giap at Vietminh headquarters
description: ALEXANDRIA, Va.  Two things predictably will be awaiting us around the next bend in history whenever formal warfare ends in Indochina. One is that the Politburo still will be ruling in Hanoi. The other is that the basic issue of the war, the question of whether the people on that battleground are to live in a closed society or an open society, will have remained unresolved. These two piobabilities, combined, are going to generate problems, in the future for every thinking American.

title: Nixon's Battle Strategy
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., Sept. 4A busy fortnight of Presidential barnstorming will come to an end tomorrow when President Nixon pays a brief visit to San Francisco and then heads for home. But in the two short weeks since he left Miami with his party's renomination Mr. Nixon has already provided im

title: New Book Crop Is Full of Novels
description: New dust jackets are popping up in the bookstores. Authors are sprucing up for their TV appearances. Glasses are clinking at Le Mistral, the Italian Pavilion and other editors haunts. And trailertrucks are lugging mountains of new books to towns around the country.

title: Advertising:
description: The new campaign by the new agency for the new models from the American Motors Corporation has been unveiledand there are plenty of changes a coming.

title: OBSERVER
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 4A NixonIan history of America:

title: Nixon Gives Press a Party At End, of Stay in California
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., Sept. 4 (AP)Spending a quiet Labor Day at his oceanside home, President Nixon ended a stay at the Western White House today by giving a party for the traveling press corps.

title: SAIGON REPORTS BASE CAMP LOSS IN HIGHLAND AREA
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Tuesday, Sept. 5Government soldiers lost a base camp near the Cambodian border in the Central Highlands yesterday in the heaviest enemy attack on that front since the height of the offensive in Kontum in April and May.

title: 2 Soldiers Wounded
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Sept. 4 (AP)Irish Republican Army marksmen wounded two soldiers in ambushes in Belfast today and the Ulster Defense Association, the Protestants hardline organization, told British troops to stop harassing its men.

title: Business Briefs
description: TOKYO, Sept. 4 (Reuters)Japan's exports are accelerating after a relative slowdown, attributed partly to the seamen's strike and partly to the 16.88 per cent revaluation of the yen last December, preliminary statistics released by the Ministry of International Trade and Industry showed today.

title: Montreal Fire Toll Now 37 As 2 Suspects Are Hunted
description: MONTREAL, Sept. 4The death toll in an explosion and fire in the Blue Bird Club in downtown Montreal Friday rose to 37 today as a nationwide manhunt was intensified for two persons sought for questioning in connection with the blast.

title: YANKEES WIN, 52, AFTER A 43 LOSS
description: BALTIMORE, Sept. 4The positive elements balanced out the negative aspects of New York's doubleheader with Baltimore tonight. When it was over, the Yankees were as near, or far, from first place as when they startedhalf a game.

title: $1.5Million Bail Asked by U S. For Reputed Heroin Smuggler
description: The Government requested yesterday that bail for Auguste Joseph Ricord, the mysterious Mr. Andre described as the kingpin of the LatinAmerican connection in heroin, be set at $1.5million.

title: FOODS STILL CARRY A TOXIC CHEMICAL
description: Three years after me Food and Drug Administration's first findings that some foods were contaminated with a toxic industrial chemical known as PCB, quantities of the persistent substance are still being found in food on grocery shelves.

title: Ukrainian First to Gain Double in 16 Years
description: MUNICH, West Germany, Sept. 4 (Reuters)Valery Borzov of the Soviet Upton became the first, man in 16 years to score an Olympic sprint double today when he added the 200meter crown to his 100meter title. He was clocked in 20 seconds flat.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The Safir letter (Aug. 26) urging Democrats not to follow the Democrats for Nixon contains the usual par for the course unadulterated fuzz.

title: Books of The Times
description: It's hard to believe that two decades have elapsed since Beckett's Waiting for Godot imprinted the concept of the Absurd on the contemporary mind. The dark truth that things do not add up, that people do not communicate, that meaning and purpose elude our lives has worked on the imagination of writers as diverse in style and tone as Ionesco, Albee, Pinter, Vonnegut, Barthelme, Nabokov and Boris Vian. Unshackled, in time, by the metaphysical underpinnings of a Godot, the Absurd has moved into a freer creative arena that includes parody, poetic drama, mystical symbolism and sheer outrageous nonsense. Once grounded in an austere nihilism, the Absurd has all but turned into a harmless entertainment ready to embrace the optimism of the American Dream.

title: Harper Dislocates Finger
description: MILWAUKEE, Sept. 4 (AP)Tommy Harper, Boston Red Sox outfielder, suffered a dislocated little finger on his left hand when hit by a pitch by Jim Lonborg of the Milwaukee Brewers in the first game of today's doubleheader.

title: U. S. Secretaries in London Low Salaries Friendly People
description: LONDON  Swinging London has wound down. Car=by Street  where it all started  Is an almost tawdry byway filled with middleaged tourists, ice cream vendors and shopkeepers on the lookout for theft.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: GENERAL ASSEMBLY Committee on the Peaceful Uses of Space3 P.M.

title: Trevino's Birdie Putt Beats Elder in SuddenDeath Hartford Golf Playoff
description: WETHERSFIELD, Conn., Sept. 4  Lee Trevino closed, with a 65 to tie Lee Elder, the black professional from Washington, in the Greater Hartford open today and then beat him with a birdie on the first hole of a suddendeath playoff.

title: Acupuncture Patients Fear Ban
description: The line begins to form at 8 o'clock these mornings on Mott Street for the last acupuncture treatments by Huan Lam Ng and his wife, Fook Kuan Lo, who, like other practitioners of the ancient art in Chinatown, are being forced by the state to close.

title: $12.75 TOP TICKET SET FOR MUSICAL
description: When the Uris Theater opens Nov. 21 with its production of the $800,000 musical Via Galactica, the new Broadway house will have a top price for Friday and Saturday evenings of $12.75, instead of the $15 top for musicals that has prevailed for those nights during recent years.

title: Bobby Allison Captures Southern 500
description: DARLINGTON, S. C., Sept. 4 (AP)  Bobby Allison's Chevrolet won it 500mile battle with David Pearson's Mercury today. in the Southern 500 stock car race, beating Pearson to the finish line by yards.

title: Furlodghed. Prisoner Held On Slaying in Barroom
description: SARASOTA, Fla., Sept. 4 (AP)A man sentenced to 20 years in jail for slaying, his wife was released froth prison on a weekend furlough and has been accused of killing his late wife's brother in a barroom argument, the police said today.

title: SOVIET OPPOSES HIJACKING PACT; OTHERS HESITANT
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 4The Soviet Union sharply opposed today a United StatesCanadian proposal for a new international convention that would require signatory nations to suspend air service with any nation that did not punish or extradite airplane hijackers or saboteurs.

title: Chicanos Reject 2 Old Parties, Then Formally Found a 3d One
description: EL PASO, Tex., Sept. 4Without funds, without a staff without real political experience, about 500 activist MexicanAmericans formed a new political party formally here shortly before dawn today.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: It was with a feeling of deep satisfaction that I read the letter City Hall Trees which appeared in The Times of Aug. 26. This feeling of apathy of city officials is well illustrated by the condition of young trees planted in Jackson Heightsbetween 72d and 75th Streets along 37th Avenue. Weeds over a foot high are part of the ugly landscape where refuse and cans are deposited. The Parks Department evidently thought that once planted they would grow like Topsy.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The decision of General Amin to oust the Asians from Uganda is appalling. Americans are not in good moral position to cast the first stone, but a more constructive response may be possible.

title: Spitz Swims to His Seventh Gold Medal; Doping Charge Bars De Mont From 1,500
description: MUNICH, West Germany, Sept 4To nobody's surprise, Mark Spitz won his seventh gold medal of the Olympics tonight with a seventh worldrecord swimming performance.

title: 12 Area School Districts Are Facing Strike Threats
description: As many as a dozen school districts in the New York metropolitan area with classes beginning tomorrow face potential strikes or other job actions by teachers, and scores, of others face the prospect of, a school year on austerity budgets.

title: Shriver Calls President Hypocrite on Work Ethic
Main Break at Wall Street
description: A 12inch water main that ruptured at about 2 A.M. yesterday in the Financial District kept Pine Street at Broadway and Thames Street and Trinity Place closed for about eight hours, the police said. The break occurred at Wall Street and Broadway. Some water seeped into the BMT and IRT subway stations, but drains handled the seepage and there was no interruption of train service.

title: Stage: A New Troupe Performs at Edinburgh Fete
description: EDINBURGH, Scotland, Sept. 4 Twentyfive yearsago, with Sir Rudolf Bing as director, the first Edinburgh International Festival got under way. Now, after a quarter of a century, it is still effortlessly established as the most important of all cultural festivals, an unsurpassed, if frequently criticized, artistic supermarket.

title: Roundup: Tigers Regain Share of Lead as Fryman Conquers Indians, 2 to 1
description: The Detroit Tigers, with help from the Yankees, pulled into a firstplace tie with Baltimore last night on the strength of Willie Horton's bat and the clutch pitching of Woody Fryman.

title: Failure of Coffee Talks Poses Question for U.S.
description: LONDON, Sept. 4  Should the price an American pays for a pound of coffee include penny, or two to help develop the economies of such countries as Colombia, El Salvador, the Ivory Coast, Ethiopia, Kenya, India and Indonesia?

title: GROWTH GAINING IN INVENTORIES
description: Inventory accumulation increased last month, according tb the August survey of the National Association of Purchasing Management.

title: Mountain Climbers Leave Litter Trail
description: Not everyone who scales a lofty summit nowadays is looking for an esthetic experience or an escape from everyday cares. Some are there to collect garbage.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The head of the largest union of postal workers the country called yesterday for the installation of a network of underground pneumatic tubes in the New.York area to speed the flow of mail. Moe Biller, president of the 27,000member ManhattanBronx Postal Union, said in a radio interview that the tubes were a major necessity view of deteriorating postal service.
