title: Philadelphia Teachers Strike; Suburbs Also Face Walkouts
description: PHILADELPHIA, Tuesday Sept. 5 (AP)Teachers in the Philadelphia school system went on strike at midnight, three days before classes are scheduled to begin.

title: JOHN B. EDGAR JR.
description: MIDDLETOWN. Conn., Sept. 4 (AP)John B. Edgar Jr., varsity swimming coach at Wes leyan University, died today, apparently after a heart attack at his home in Portland. He was 38 years old.

title: Folk Music Festival Recalls Labor's Past
description: Three young women wearing, Smokey Bear hats were among a lot of people who got homesick yesterday as U. Utah Phillipsa labor folklorist and former railroad boomer sang about hoboes, cattle and timber barons and Western hardrock miners.

title: An Uprising by 16 At Jersey Prison Ends Peacefully
description: TRENTON, Tuesday, Sept. 5 Sixteen inmates of Trenton State Prison who seized control last night of the first floor of the institution's readjustment unit went back to their cells early today.

title: Turnaround on Drugs?
description: New York City may, at last, be making a modest dent in its massive drug problem. Preliminary statistics on drugrelated deaths for the first seven months of this year make municipal health officials hopeful that rapidly spreading scourge may have peaked. Health Services Administrator Gordon Chase, who offers this assessment, deserves credit for bringing some incipient measure of order to the city's Previously chaotic antiaddiction struggle.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: To date most efforts in the control of narcotics have proven of little avail. It occurs to me that it is about time that Draconian measures were used in the sentencing of narcotics dealers, whether they are small or large. In other words, harsh sentences should be meted out to all sellers of narcotics. It seems rather obvious that if the pusher or small dealer were removed from the picture, the wholesalers would have no market for their wares. Like all businesses, they mat have retail outlets to survive.

title: GERARD K. LAKE, 67, TEXTILE EXECUTIVE
description: NEW CANAAN, Conn., Sept. 4  Gerard Kirsopp Lake, who retired in 1969 as director of new product development for Burlington Industries, died of.a heart :attack yesterday.tat his home here. He;was 67 years old.

title: Cow Bell at the Olympics
description: MUNICH, West Germany, Sept. 4 (AP)The Munich Olympics are the most technically advanced, with computers and electronic devices galore. But when it comes to signaling the last lap for the swimmers, an official goes to the side of the pool and rings a cow bell.

title: Chinese Reds, in Manila, Notice Nationalists and Shun Marcos
description: MANILA, Sept. 4Three officers from a Chinese Communist ship went to call on President Ferdinand E. Marcos this morning but left without seeing the President when they learned he had just received the Chinese Nationalist Ambassador, Liu Chieh.

title: Cambodia Posts Reported Freed
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Sept. 4 (Reuters)Cambodian infantrymen relieved four besieged positions today close to Pnompenh on the main highway to the south against only minor enemy resistance, a military command spokesman said.

title: Olympic Personalities: Dirtiest of the Dirty
description: Do you always play dirty? someone asked 30yearOld Mirko Sandic of Yugoslavia.

title: McGovern's Gospel
description: PRINCETON, N.J.One cannot listen to the speeches of George McGovern without being aware that he comes from South Dakota, from middle America, and from the Protestant prairies where he was reared according to the Scriptures of his father's Fundamentalist religion.

title: LOUD CAPTURES GOVERNOR STAKE
description: Loud withstood a claim of foul and won the $118,600 Governor Stakes at Belmont Park yesterday. A good runner once he gets going, Loud advanced steadily under the guidance of Jacinto Vasquez and took the 1 1.8mile event by head.

title: VOLUNTEERS HELP ON INTEGRATION
description: EAST PALO ALTO, Calif., Sept. 4When the new school year opens tomorrow at Ravenswood High School in this mostly black suburban community, nearly 500 white students will be in class.

title: Canadians Conquer Soviet Six, 4 to 1
description: TORONTO, Sept. 4Team Canada remembered to shake hands tonight.

title: Soviet Alters Degree Rules, With View to Social Needs
description: MOSCOW, Sept. 4The Soviet Union, In an apparent move to raise the standards of scientific research, has tightened the rules for awarding degrees with the avowed aim of making dissertations more relevant to the nation's needs.

title: Arthur Daley
description: MUNICH, West Germany, Sept. 4When Bill Toomey was winning the final tryouts en route to his Olympic decathlon championship four years ago, he made a sympathetic appraisal of the talents of Jeff Bennett, the fifth place finisher.

title: BROOKLYN PARADE ATTRACTS 150,000
description: Colorfully dressed masmen, or masqueraders, and swaying Panmen, or steeldrum players, drew a crowd that the police estimated at more than 150,000 yesterday for Brooklyn's sixth annual Vest IndianAmerican Day Parade.

title: How to Be a Celebrity
description: MUNICH, West Germany, Sept. 4 (AP)If anyone in Munich wants to feel like a celebrity, all he has to do is to put on a sweat suit and go walking in Olympic Park. Anyone looking remotely like an athlete is stopped by autograph hunters.

title: CITY MAY EXTEND ETHNICGROUP AID
description: Human Resources Administrator Jule M. Sugarman said yesterday that Mayor Lindsay and he were concerned whether antipoverty programs were reaching all appropriate groups.

title: The Founder of Jews for Jesus,' In Rally Here, Stresses He's Jew
description: Moishe Rosen, 40yearold founder and spokesman for the controversial Jews for Jesus movement, described.himself yesterday as a. JeW who believes that Jesus Christ is truly the Messiah.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: I read with interest the frontpage description (Aug. 14) of primary methadone abuse and addiction.

title: UgandaAsians See Ouster Hurting Africans
description: KAMPALA, Uganda Night falls early on Kampala, leaving the streets, with their Indian and Pakistani shops, eerily silent. Bougainvillaea and oleander sweeten the air, weaver birds chirp loudly, police and army cars prowl the frightened city.

title: RED TAPE BLAMED FOR LOSS IN RELIEF
description: Auditors from the office of State Controller Arthur Levitt reported yesterday that because of city dataprocessing deficiencies the city and state had paid $2,808,639, which should have been reimbursed by the Federal Government, for aged, blind and disabled welfare cases in a 22month period.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Politics remains the same. McGovern in his Legion cap looked like Coolidge in his Indian headdress.

title: Seven for Spitz
description: As usual, the current Olympic Games in Munich are producing a new crop of sports heroes and forcing wholesale revision, of the record books. But nothing that has happened in Munich so farthis summer can compare with the awesome feats of Mark Spitz, swimmer extraordinary. It seemed ridiculous a few weeks ago when some observers suggested that Spitz would win seven gold medals and thereby set a new Olympic mark in this respect. But that is exactly what the dentisttobe from Carmichael, Calif., has done. His is clearly the outstanding individual performance of the 1972 Olympics, and his record bag of gold medals will not soon or easily be surpassed. Mark Spitz, like Bobby Fischer, provides useful reminder that old fogies Inclined to denigrate Americans under thirty need to take a better look at this new and very promising younger generation.

title: Joint Cancer Fight
description: No field of cancer research is being pushed more intensively than the search for the viruses which, many researchers believe, are the causes of numerous cancers. key reason for the zeal in this effort is the fact that isolation of cancer viruses would open the way for the development of anticancer vaccines analogous to those now widely used against other viruscaused diseases such polio.

title: Markets Were Closed
description: Securities and commodities exchanges in the United States and Canada were closed yesterday in observance of Labor Day. Banks and governmental offices and most businesses were also closed for the holiday. Overseas exchanges for the most part remained open.

title: Contract to Westinghouse
description: PITTSBURGH, Sept. 4The Niagara Mohawk Power Corporation has awarded the Westinghouse Electric Corporation an order valued at $19million for an 815,000kilowatt turbinegenerator unit, Westinghouse announced today, The turbinegenerator will be the sixth unit to go into the company's Oswego power generating complex on Lake Ontario and is scheduled for operation in 1976.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Despite the claim of Senator McGovern's Jewish affairs unit that this year, for the first time, the question of support for Israel has been made an election issue by the Republican party (news story Aug. 29), the fact remains that the much discussed Jewish disaffection from their traditional Democratic Presidential preference only began after Senator McGovern was named his party's candidate.

title: MAX HOLLANDER
description: Max Hollander, who retired as a composing room foreman for advertising at The New York Times in 1968, died Friday at his home, 4210 Colden Street, Flushing, Queens. His age was 65. Mr. Hollander joined The Times in 1949.

title: British Prisons Rocked by Disturbances
description: NEWPORT, Isle of Wight, Sept. 4The guidebooks call this The Garden Isle and the tourists flow from the mainland to bundle up and sit on the chilly beaches as sailboats whisper by under overcast skies.

title: Heath Reported in Tough Mood at Talks With Lynch in Munich
description: MUNICH. West Germany, Sept. 4  Prime Minister Heath of Britain conferred for 90 minutes here today with Premier John Lynch of Ireland in an apparently fruitless attempt to deal with the Northern Ireland problem.

title: Likened to Dreyfus
description: For almost 25 years the phrase Free Tom Mooney symbolized one of the nation's most flagrant miscarriages of justice. The other man in the case, which was fought from 1916 to 1939, was Warren Knox Billings, who was convicted for the same crime as Mr. Mooney and who was his coprisoner in California until they were freed after unceasing public protests.

title: An Olympian Rhubarb
description: MUNICH, West Germany, Sept. 4Instead of basking in the glow of its most impressive singleday show in swimming at the 20th Olympic Games, the United States Olympic Committee found itself involved tonight in another major crisis.

title: Obituary 2  No Title
description: The directors of New York Securities Co.

title: Finnish President Appoints A FourParty Government
description: HELSINKI, Finland, Sept. 4 (Agence FrancePresse)  The President, Dr. Urho Kekkonen, today appointed a fourparty coalition Government headed by Kalevi Sorsa, a Social Democrat.

title: Bridge: Becker's Team Captures Third Straight Tourney
description: The knockout event of the Knickerbocker tournament held over the Labor Day weekend at the New York Hilton ended in a victory for the topseeded team of B. Jay Becker, his son, Michael, and Jeff Rubens, all of New York, and Andy Bernstein of Knoxville, Tenn.

title: Business Briefs
description: TORONTO, Sept. 4 (AP)International Nickel of Canada, Ltd., the world's. largest producer of nickel, announced an increase today of 20 cents (United States) pound in its price of electrolytic nickel.

title: Volcker Warns Europeans Not to Impose Money Ideas
description: ALPBACH, Austria, Sept 4  Paul A. Volcker, Under Secretary of the Treasury for Monetary Affairs, warned Ettropean nations here today not to try to impose ,their ideas of monetary order on the rest of the world.

title: Behind the Facade
description: The police mean business; so do the midtown merchants of pornography. It's the hassle against the hustle. No sooner do the cops lay down the law than the porno dealers spring up in the same or another locale. There the matter stands these days in the continuous saga of what makes the Times Square area a boulevard of filth instead of a Great White Way.

title: WEEK OF HARDSHIP FACED BY ROMANS
description: ROME, Sept. 4Romans today faced a week of frustration as all the city's butchers started a shutdown and neighborhood markets remained closed.

title: Teachers Cause Championed By Wife of School Board Head
description: There is a guidance counselor at Public School 85 in the Bronx who thinks that the Board of Education doesn't know what it's talking about when it contends that teachers have been abusing their preparation periods and that principals should be given power to assign them to specific duties during these nonteaching periods.

title: JACK ECKERD CORP. SETS ACQUISITION
description: The Jack Eckerd Corporation, Clearwater, Fla., and Ward's CutRate Drug Company, Dallas, announced over the weekend that Jack M. Eckerd, chairman of Eckerd, and Harold Simmons,. president of Ward's, had agreed in principle to merge Ward's CutRate into subsidiary of Eckerd.

title: Multicolor Liners Becoming Standard
description: Passenger ships, like passenger automobiles, used to come in only one colorbasic black.

title: GRUMMAN FACES SHUTTLE SETBACK
description: The North American Rockwell Corporation, the Californiabased aerospace manufacturer that last month won the prime contract for the $2.6billion space shuttle, may retain up to 70 per cent of the contract money for itself and its four principal subcontracting partners on the original shuttle proposal, company and industry sources have indicated.

title: M'GOVERN SCORES NIXON JOB STAND IN A BID TO LABOR
description: CHIPPEWA LAKE, Ohio, Sept. 4Senator George McGo fern opened the official phase of his national campaign in this key industrial state with a promise to bring the real George McGovern to the people.

title: PAUL FAGAN JR.
description: SANTA BARBARA, Calif., Sept. 4Paul Fagan Jr., a retired stockbroker and a member of a wellknown San Francisco family, died of a heart attack yesterday at his home in Montecito. He was 56 years old.

title: Summer Exits Unofficially Amid Family Sun Rites
description: Astronomically, summer has 15 days to go, but realistically, specifically and concretelyin terms understood by every youngster who is about to get new shoes, new notebooks and new pens and pencilssummer ended yesterday.

title: Sampling by City Finds TV Repairs Deceptive
description: Seven of eight television repair concerns that were asked by investigators posing as customers to fix sets with a single minor defect either performed unnecessary work or charged for work not done, the city's Department of Consumer Affairs reported yesterday.

title: Maddox Is Hopeful Nixon Will Devastate McGovern
Last 20 Quit Madrid
description: MADRID, Sept. 4 (AP)The last 20 of some 100 stranded airline travelers left Madrid today on flights to New York, an airline spokesman announced.

title: IN THE NATION
description: NANTUCKET, Mass., Sept. 4More than 400 people turned out on this heavily Republican island last week when folk singer Bill Schustig billed concert as a benefit for George McGovern. But not even the man who asked for McGovern contributions felt they were all McGovern votes or even potential McGovern voters. Here, as apparently almost everywhere else, the traditional Labor Day opening of the Presidential campaign finds Richard Nixon far out front and not even breathing hard.

title: Hitachi in Chinese Contract
description: TOKYO, Sept. 4 (UPI)The Hitachi Shipbuilding and Engineering Company of Osaka has signed a contract to build two freighters of 14,300 tons dead weight for the Chinese Government. They will be the first Japanese exports of freighters to China since 1964,

title: No Damage in Coast Quake
description: HOLLISTER, Calif., Sept. (UPI)  A sharp earthquake shook the central California coastal area today but apparently caused no damage or injuries.

title: Nancy Oberdorfer, Librarian, Wed
description: TARRYTOWN, N. Y., Sept. 4 The marriage of Miss Nancy Oberdorfer, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Henry Oberdorfer of Scarsdale, to Peter Jones Aranow took place this afternoon at Tarrytown House. Rabbi Julius Rosenthal performed the ceremony. The bridegroom is a son of Dr. and Mrs. Henry Aranow Jr. of HastingsonHudson and New Hartford, Conn.

title: Iceland's Fishermen Warn They'll Act Against British
description: REYKJAVIK, Iceland, Sept. 4 (Reuters)Fishermen on Iceland's northwest coast today threatened to take the law into their own hands against British trawlers unless the Britons withdraw from inside Iceland's new 50Mile fishing limit.

title: Bronx Man Pleads Guilty To 1971 Murder of Girl, 8
description: A 25yearold restaurant worker pleaded, guilty yesterday. to a murder charge in the fourth day of his trial in State Supreme Court in the Bronx.

title: Historian Finds Class Origin in China Determines Who Are The People
description: Who are the People, the subject and object of every political slogan in China?

title: TWO GUARDS OUSTED IN PRISON STABBING
description: SMYRNA, Del., Sept. 5 (AP) Two prison guards at the Delaware Correctional Center near here have been dismissed and a Iongterm prisoner praised following an investigation of a recent stabbing incident.

title: Traffic Toll Is Put at 580
description: Traffic accidents across the country took 580 lives during the Labor Day weekend, according to the National Safety Council. During the 1971 Labor Day weekend, 616 persons died in traffic accidents.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAING
description: HILTON HEAD, S.C., Sept. 5 (AP)Vice President Agnew appealed to the Southern Governors Conference tonight not to make revenue sharing a partisan issue in the Presidential campaign.

title: Robinson Concern Plans Housing for Brooklyn
description: Jackie Robinson, a member of baseball's Hall of Fame and a former Brooklyn Dodger player, announced yesterday that his construction company would build a $17million, lowandmiddleincome apartment complex in the BedfordStuyvesant section of Brooklyn.

title: ALIMONY OFFENDER HAS RECORD VOIDED
description: A 54yearold Bronx computer repairman who served 30 days in jail for failure to post bond for delinquency in his alimony payents won his fight yesterday for the return of evidence taken by the court in connection with his incarceration.

title: Gore Is Named Chairman Of Island Creek Coal Co.
description: Former Senator Albert. Gore of Tennessee, a longtime critic of business concentration and of industrial pollution, yesterday became chairman of the Island Creek Coal Company, Cleveland, the nation's thirdlargest coal producer.

title: Elizabeth City Hall Under Investigation
description: TRENTON, Sept. 5Law enforcement authorities reported here today that the administration of Mayor Thomas J. Dunn of Elizabeth was the target of Union County grand jury investigation of alleged municipal corruption.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: GENERAL ASSEMBLY Committee on the Peaceful Uses of Space10;30 A.M. and 3 P.M.

title: MUJIB IS EXPECTED TO VISIT NEW DELHI
description: NFW DELHI, Sept. 5Sheik Mujibur Rahman, Prime Minister of Bangladesh, will come here Sept. 16 to meet Prime Minister Indira Gandhi, authoritative sources.said today. The meeting is expected to help reduce frictions that have developed in the relations between India and Bangladesh.

title: About Pro Football
description: The Bidwill brothers, owners of the St. Louis Cardinals, have agreed to split and the younger one, Bill, will buy out Charles. W. (Stormy) Bidwill's share for $6.5million. That establishes the franchise's worth at $13million, a reasonable figure.

title: GUARD'S TECHNICIANS STAGE 1DAY PROTEST
description: More than 500 civilian technicians in the New York National Guard ignored orders, effective yesterday, to report in uniform, and instead reported to work in civilian clothes at installations throughout the state, the Association of Civilian Technicians reported.

title: European Money Views Held Divided
description: ALPBACH, Austria, Sept. 5The president of the Austrian National Bank said today that major European nations would come to the annual meeting of the International Monetary Fund at the end of this month divided and uncertain as to their views on longterm reform of the world financial system.

title: 66 Law Men Killed in 19721
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5 (UPI) Seven law enforcement officers were killed in the line of duty during August, bringing the total to 66 throughout the nation this year, the Federal Bureau of Investigation's uniform crime reports showed today.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAING
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5 (AP) President Nixon returned to the White House tonight from California.

title: Reports First Said Israelis Were Safe
description: Contradictory reports last night about the fate of the Israeli hostages seized by Arab terrorists in the Olympic Village threw the public into confusion all over the world.

title: Philadelphia Strike On
description: PHILADELPHIA, Sept. 5 (UPI)About 285,000 public school students in Philadelphia, which has the nation's fourthlargest school system, faced the prospect of a prolonged summer vacation today because of a strike over wages called this morning by the local teachers union. School was scheduled to Have begun tomorrow.

title: Inquiry on Bugging Asked
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5 (UPI) Julius Hobson, VicePresidential candidate of the radical People's party, asked today for a formal Congressional investigation of the Watergate bugging incident.

title: U.S. ASKS HIGH COURT TO STAY BUSING PLAN
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5 (UPI)  The Justice Department asked the Supreme Court today to postpone courtordered school busing intended to achieve racial balance in the public schools in Las Vegas, Nev.

title: Method of Release Specified
description: CAIRO, Sept., 5 (Agence FrancePresse) The document said, to have been distributed by the Black September guerrilla organization said that the released prisoners were to board any nonIsraeli plane and fly to any Arab capital other than Amman, Jordan, or Beirut, Lebanon.

title: NASA Contract Planned
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5 (AP) The National Aeronautics and Space Administration said today that it would negotiate a twoyear, $874,000 contract with the Raytheon Services Company of Burlington, Mass., for technical documentation and editing services.

title: Rev.IrenaeusSchoenherr,93, Served Parish Here Since'26
description: The Rev. Irenaeus Schoenherr, who entered the Franciscan order in Germany in 1897 and had been a priest at St. Francis of Assisi Roman Catholic Church, 135 West 31st Street, since 1926, died Monday in the infirmary of St. Bonaventure University in Olean, N. Y. He was 93 years old.

title: GateCrashing at Village Easy Despite the Guards
description: MUNICH, West Germany, Sept. 5Anyone who wants to crash the Olympic Village badly enough, as Arab guerrillas did early this morning in search of Israeli athletes and officials, can succeed without much difficulty.

title: Canadian Reserves Climb
description: OTTAWA, Sept. 5 (Reuters) Canada's official international reserves rose $8.2million (United States) to $6,199,400,000. during August, the Finance Ministry announced today. Holdings of American dollars were up $9.4million from July 31 to $4.524,100,000. Holdings of other foreign currencies rose $1million.

title: Inflation Talkes Set
description: BRUSSELS, Sept. 5 (AP) The Common Market's new economic and financial coordinating committee will meet Friday at France's request to discuss concerted measures against inflation, sources said today.

title: Merger News
description: The Grumman Corporation hopes to expand its share of the general aviation market through a merger of its commercial aircraft operations with the privately held American Aviation Corporation.

title: 40 Youths Trying To Take Over Bus Balked in Bronx
description: Some 40 members of the Black Spades, a South Bronx street gang, attempted to commandeer a Transit Authority bus list night, but the police routed them before they carried out threats to kill the driver, according to the police.

title: Advertising: New Posts at Time
description: Time Inc. announced yesterday a series of executive changes, the most important of which was the creation of three group vice presidents, a title new to the corporation.

title: Impeachment Panel Is Enjoined From Further Political Actions
description: An injunction was issued in Federal Court here yesterday to bar political activities by committee seeking to impeach President Nixon for his conduct of the war in Vietnam.

title: AMEX PRICES DIP IN SLOW TRADING
description: Dwindling prices accompanied slow trading on the American Stock Exchange yesterday as the exchange's index closed at 26.62, off 0.05. In overthecounter activity the N.A.S.D. index closed at 132.95, off 0.70.

title: Buffalo Teachers Ratify New OneYear Contract
description: BUFFALO, Sept. 5 (AP)The Buffalo Teachers Federation ratified late yesterday a contract agreed upon by bargainers earlier in the day.

title: Florida Pay Rise Approved
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5 (AP)The Pay Board approved a pay increase for more than 67,000 elected and career officials in Florida. The increase amounted to 6.5 per cent for 66,822 career workers, a board spokesman said, with 1.2 per cent more in qualified fringe benefits.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Melton of Smith Barney Joining Dean Witter &
description: Dean Witter & Co. announced yesterday that Andrew J. Melton Jr. had joined the firm as executive vice president in charge of investmentbanking activities. William M. Witter, chairman, said Mr. Melton also would be nominated to the concern's board of directors at its next meeting.

title: Books of The Times
description: It is a corner of history that some of us have forgotten and many of us never knew. It is summed up in a few pages of R. Ernest and Trevor N. Dupuy's The Encyclopedia of Military History From 3500 B. C. to the Present under the headings: Eastern Fronts: Operations in East Prussia: The Russian Offensive: The Tannenberg Campaign: 1914, August 2631, Battle of Tannenburg, with the concluding Comment that Incompetent leadership, faulty reconnaissance, lack of secrecy, and poor communications, added to an astounding state of unpreparedness and shortage of matdriel, all contributed to Russian defeats. Russia never completely recovered from these disasters. And it is what Alexander Solzhenitsyn has picked as the first act in the drama of 20thcentury Russian history he plans to spend the rest of his life imagining in his fiction. It is what he has breathed and breathed upon in order to fill with blood and shouts and the clatter of warfare. And the questions now arise: is August 1914 the extraliterary cultural event of the year, destined to gather dust on 100,000 coffee tables? Or is it really a great work of fiction?

title: Guerrilla Denial Reported
description: BEIRUT, Sept. 5 (Reuters)A Lebanese Government spokesman said tonight that the Palestine Liberation Organization, the overall guerrilla group, had denied any connection with the guerrilla attack in Munich.

title: 2 City Unions Assail Idea Of Tax Pledge to Get Job
description: The city's policemen's and firemen's unions yesterday denounced as discriminatory a proposal that prospective city employes who live in the suburbs agree to pay full city taxes as a condition for employment.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: London Trading Low Key For Foreign Currencies
description: LONDON, Sept. 5 (UPI) Lowkey trading in currencies on the London foreign exchange market today barely stirred rates all day.

title: Larceny Kid Steals Royal Gem Purse
583,923 Were at State Fair
description: SYRACUSE, Sept. 5 (AP)The 1972 New York State Fair, which ended yesterday, drew a sevenday total of 583,923. That was ahead of last year's attendance of 527,576, but short of 1970, the record year with 601,478, officials said.

title: U.D.C. Is Building Community for 18,000 in Lysander
description: BALDWINSVILLE, N.Y., Sept. 5Despite troubles in other parts of the state, notably in the rural areas of Westchester County, one of the Urban Development Corporation's most ambitious projects is moving along on schedule.

title: After Shooting at Airport, Frantic Hunt for Gunmen
description: FURSTENFELDBRUCK, West Germany, Wednesday, Sept. 6The frantic search for the missing Arab gunmen focused early this morning in and around this sprawling military air base amid the intermittent sounds of automatic gunfire.

title: Lineup Begins at 5 A.M. For Met Opera Tickets
description: Opera enthusiasts rose early yesterday for the'opening day of ticket sales for the first two weeks of the Metropolitan Opera's 197273 season.

title: Business Briefs
description: CALGARY, Alberta, Sept. 5 (Canadian Press)Consolidated Natural Gas, Ltd., of Calgary has announced a contract with TransCanada Pipelines, Ltd., of Toronto for the sale of about three trillion cubic feet of natural gas reserves in Alberta.

title: 6% ELIGIBLE GIVEN TRAINING OR JOBS
description: During the first year of experience with the state workrelief law, 6 per cent of the affected relief clients were placed in jobs or training for some time, the state reported yesterday.

title: Play Based on 4 Murders To Run at Public Theater
description: A play based on the murder of four persons and the wounding of seven others in a Raleigh, N. C., shopping center last May, by a janitor named Harvey Glenn McLeod, who then took his own life, will be performed at the Martinson Hall of the Public Theater, 425 Lafayette Street.

title: Unanswered Questions
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5  When President Nixon on Feb. 7 signed the law requiring full disclosure of political campaign contributions and expenditures, he paid, By giving the American public full access to the facts of political financing, this legislation will guard against campaign abuses and will work to build public confidence in the integrity of the electoral process.

title: NO YONKERS RUSH ON LADIES'
description: YONKERS, Sept. 5Ladies Night, a promotion aimed at introducing new fans to harness racing, did not have the women breaking down doors at Yonkers Raceway tonight. Of the total attendance of 13,874, only 1,551 were women admitted for cutrate prices.

title: Paul W. Steer Dies at 63; ExHead of Cincinnati Bar
description: CINCINNATI, Sept. 5Paul W. Steer, a former president of the Cincinnati Bar Association and of the Cincinnati Council on World Affairs, died here yesterday at the age of 63.

title: Stage: Raves Few on London Musicals
description: LONDONWhatever happened to the British musical? Nothing ever happened to the British musicalwhich is really the story of its death. People, in happy retrospect, talk about Lionel Bart's Oliver as if it were the British equivalent of The Sound of Music. Perhaps it was.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Gunman Steals Jewels From Chicago Museum
description: CHICAGO, Sept. 5 (Reuters)A robber wearing a red and black ski cap and gloves stole $12,000 in gems from the Field Museum today. The police said he had apparently secreted himself in the museum overnight.

title: Business Briefs
description: Cooper Industries, Inc., announced in Houston yesterday that it would supply equipment and technology to the Soviet Union for use in developing that country's natural gas transmission network. A 10year agreement to that effect was signed by the company with Licensintorg, an official Soviet Government agency.

title: Attica Uprising Memorials Set For City and Outside the Prison
description: Conditions at the State Correctional Facility at Attica were characterized yesterday as barbarous and shocking by spokesmen for the prisoners as they announced plans here for a series of events next Wednesday to commemorate the first anniversary of last fall's inmate rebellion at the state institution.

title: Executive Changes
description: Vincent T. Dunning has been named a senior vice president of James Talcott Factors, a division of James Talcott, Inc.

title: Shriver in Albany
description: ALBANY, Sept. 5 (UPI)Mr. Shriver asserted today that the Nixon sales tax had added 15 to 18 per cent to the grocery bills of Ameri cans.

title: Roundup: Tigers Win, Seize First Place Alone
Harlem 4 Trial Adjourned; Motions Still Pending Cited
description: The fourth trial of the socalled Harlem Four, scheduled to begin yesterday in State Supreme Court in Manhattan, was adjourned indefinitely by Justice Irwin D. Davidson because defense motions to dismiss the eightyearold murder case were still pending.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAING
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Sept. 5President Nixon assailed Congress today for leaving the vast bulk of his environmental legislation mired in inaction and jurisdictional squabbles.

title: Niagara Falls Study Says Graft There Is Not Widespread
description: NIAGARA FALLS, N.Y., Sept. 5A report made public today said that corruption was not severe in this city's police department, but that its efficiency was hampered by interference from politicians and other outsiders.

title: Refuses Microphones
description: MUNICH, Sept. 5 (Reuters)There was tight security at the news conference today and Mark Spitz refused to stand at a battery of microphones because of the Arab commando attack. He sat amid United States team officials, Olympic guards and soldiers.

title: Goodman Charges City Agencies Do Virtually Nothing to Alleviate Corruption in Construction Industry
description: State Senator Roy M. Goodman charged yesterday that city agencies did virtually nothing to anticipate or alleviate corruption involving the $2.5billionayear construction industry.

title: 15 Complete March for Peace In Handcuffs and Also End Fast
description: Fifteen participants in a prisoners' march for peace that began in Danbury, Conn., arrived here yesterday and ended an eightday fast with juice and soup.

title: McGovern Names Jet The Dakota Queen 2
description: SEATTLE, Sept. 5 (UPI)Senator George McGovprn has named a new chartered aircraft Dakota Queen 2 after the B24 bomber he I piloted during World War, II.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAING
description: LOS ANGELES, Sept. 5Senator George McGovern, plainly heartened by a succession of large and fervent Labor Day crowds, today carried his increasingly sharp attacks on President Nixon back into the battleground state of California.

title: RICHEY PUTS OUT LAVER IN 4 SETS AT FOREST HILLS
Theft Is Laughing Matter
description: SPOKANE, Wash. (UPI)A thief stole a cylinder containing 1886 pounds of nitrous oxidecommonly called laughing gas from a warehouse, the police reported.

title: Planners Foresee Extensive Growth Of Dutchess and Peril to Bucolic Aura
description: Dutchess County, at the northern edge of the urban ring whose center is New York City, was depicted yesterday as facing a crucial choice: Will it retain its semirural charm by accommodating its population and its physical growth in planned centers? Or will it become another part of spread city stretching out from the metropolis?

title: The issue will be employed by Hanoi
description: WASHINGTONNot only is November the month for the U.S. election, but more important to North Vietnam, it is the time for harvesting the most important crop of the year. The, dike issue will therefore be employed by Hanoi for dual purposes: to influence public opinion abroad and to justify poor agricultural performance at home.

title: Saigon Reports Repulsing an Enemy Attack on a Pleiku Outpost
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Wednesday, Sept. 6 (AP)North Vietnamese forces attacked South Vietnamese militia outpost in the Central Highlands yesterday only 12 miles southwest of Pleiku but were repulsed, the Saigon command reported.

title: Fedayeen Fulfill '71 Vow By Major Raids Abroad
description: We shall continue the struggle, a member of the Arab commando Central Committee declared a year ago in Amman, Jordan, and since then the commandos have staged a succes sion of major attacks outside Jordanian soil.

title: McGovern's Aides Deny Charges by Dole
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5Spokesmen for Senator George McGovern issued a pointbypoint denial today of new charges by Senator Robert J. Dole of Kansas, chairman of the Republican National. Committee, that the Democratic Presidential candidate had committed at least, as many violations of the Federal campaign finance law as Mr. McGovern has accused the campaign committees of President Nixon of doing.

title: Police Too Busy to Respond, Woman Is Stabbed to Death
description: SAN JOSE, Calif., Sept 5 (AP)A housewife was stabbed to death after officers told her that they were too busy to respond to her telephone call for help, the police said.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAING
description: FORT WORTH, Tex., Sept. 5 (AP)Dr. Joseph H. Jackson, president of the National Baptist Convention, U.S.A., announced today his support for the reelection of President Nixon. Dr. Jackson, who was one of the few black leaders to endorse Mr. Nixon in 1968, said he was speaking only for himself and no for his organization, which is holding its 92d annual convention here this week.

title: Builders Group Here Seeks Federal Aid to End Strike by Construction Workers
description: Maurice S. Paprin, president of the Associated Builders and Owners of Greater New York, said yesterday that the group had asked for Federal help to end the twomonthold strike by building and construction workers here.

title: Israeli Team Had 18 Athletes and Coaches
description: MUNICH, West Germany, Sept. 5 (UPI)  The Israeli Olympic team consisted of 18 athletes and coaches, plus other officials. Fifteen athletes and coaches were housed at the Glympic Village, while two yachtsmen and one sailing team leader were at Kiel on the Baltic, site of the Olympic yachting competition.

title: L. I. Youth Held in Slaying Of Telephone Operator, 17
description: HAUPPAUGE, L. I., Sept. 6 (AP)A 17yearold unemployed grocery clerk was charged today with the fated stabbing of a 17yearold Bay Shore girl whose body was found in a wooded area near her home last Thursday.

title: Teachers Approve Pact
description: WAPPINGER FALLS, N. Y., Sept. 5 (UPI)Members of the Central School Teachers Association here unanimously approved today a new contract with the school district. The district, serving part of Dutchess County, has an enrollment of about 14,000 pupils. Classes are scheduled to start tomorrow. Details of the contract were not immediately available.

title: Spitz Guarded by Troops
description: MUNICH, West Germany, Sept. 5 (AP)Mark Spitz held a 40minute news conference at the Olympic press center today and then was escorted by West German soldiers to a television studio, to a downtown hotel and then to the airport.

title: Pennsy Seeks to Rent Cars
description: PHILADELPHIA, Sept. 5 (AP) The Penn Central Transportation Company has asked United States District Court here for permission to lease 500 new boxcars before the end of the year to increase freight revenues. Trustees of the company, which is undergoing reorganization under United States bankruptcy laws, told the court Tuesday that the annual rental for the cars would be just over $1million. They added that the new equipment would produce about $3.4million a year in

title: Trip Announced in Soviet
description: MOSCOW, Sept. 5Mr. Kissinger's scheduled visit to Moscow was reported without elaboration by Tass, the Soviet press agency, as the press criticized both the United States and Japan on continuation of the Vietnam war.

title: Ely Jacques Kahn, Leading Architect, Dies at 88
description: Ely Jacques Kahn, the architect for many wellknown commercial and residential buildings in New York, died yesterday at Mount Sinai Hospital. He was 88 years old and lived at 1185 Park Avenue.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Carolina Textile Company Reduces 4Day Week to 3
description: GASTONIA, N.C., Sept. 5 (AP)The Wales Manufacturing Company, a textile concern that produces knitted fabrics, went on a threeday work week yesterday.

title: YanksTriumph OiverOrioles,76
description: SALTIMORE, Sept. 5 Unlike Cinderella's fairy tale, George Medich's didn't have a happy ending. It didn't even last long enough for Ralph Houk to place a glass slipper on his size 13 foot.

title: No Surprise in Beirut
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Sept. 5The Black September guerrilla organization's claim of responsibility for the attack on Israeli athletes in Munich came as no surprise here.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A special narcotics court designed to speed the prosecution of narcotics felony cases was opened amid some confusion yesterday as lawyers for some defendants arrived late for the first calendar call. Some attorneys had gone to other courts, only to find that the cases had been scheduled to be heard in one of five new trial parts at the Civil Court Building, 111 Centre Street.

title: Personalities: 20th Deal Makes Svare a Master
description: Pro football has a new master trader. Harland Svare, coach and vice president of the San Diego Chargers, has taken the honors away from George Allen of the Washington Redskins. With the acquisition of Leonard Dunlap, a defensive back, from the Baltimore. Colts for an undisclosed future draft pick, Svare has made deals involving 20 players in the eight months he has been in San Diego. Allen had set a National Football League high in dealing for 19 players a year ago. Dunlap was the Colts top draft pick in 1971.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAING
description: PLEASANTON, Calif., Sept. 5I don't know who I'm going to vote for, but it will probably be McGovern, said Mrs. Millie Falasca, as she served a visitor a piece of homemade marble cake. I don't care for Nixon at all. I think he's sneaky, sly and slick.

title: Sports of The Times
description: MUNICH, West Germany, Sept. 5Olympic Village was under siege. Two men lay murdered and nine others were held at gunpoint in imminent peril of their lives. Still the games went on. Canoeists paddled through their races. Fencers thrust and parried in makebelieve duels. Boxers scuffled. Basketball players scampered across the floor like happy children. Walled off in their dream world, appallingly unaware of the realities of life and death, the aging playground directors who conduct this quadrennial muscle dance ruled that a little blood must not be permitted to interrupt play.

title: Wendell L. Phillips Dead; President of Maine Banki
description: PRESQUE ISLE, Me., Sept. 5 (AP)  Wendell L. Phillips, president of the Northern National Bank since 1963, died today in a hospital. He was 59 years old.

title: JOHN H. MAGRUDER 3D
description: BOSTON, Sept. 5John H. Magruder 3d, director of the Smithsonian Institution's national armed forces museum advisory board, drowned on Sunday in Falmouth, Mass. Mr. Magruder, who was 55 years old, apparently lost his balance as he tried to board his ketch from a dinghy.

title: Ulster Protestant Plan Offers Catholics More Voice in Rule
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland. Sept. 5A modified form of Governipent that would give the Roman Catholic minority a larger role, in the administration of Northern Ireland was proposed today by the Unionist party, which represents the province's Protestant majority.

title: DR. LEONARD PARIS, PATHOLOGIST, DEAD
description: NEW HYDE PARK, L.I., Sept. 5Dr. Leonard Paris, a pathologist and teacher of pathology, died of cancer yesterday at Long Island Jewish Hospital. He was 56 years old and lived at 102 Beach Drive.

title: JUDGE EXTENDS STAY IN DISPUTE AT TIMES
description: State Supreme Court Justice Joseph DiFede yesterday extended indefinitely a temporary stay, ordered after a oneday strike last month, against any slowdown or work stoppage against The New York Times by New York Mailers Union No. 6.

title: 10Term Nevada Congressman Loses in Primary
description: Representative Walter S. Baring lost his bid yesterday for renomination to an 11th term in Congress in Nevada's Democratic primary. Meanwhile North Dakotans nominated candidates to succeed Gov. William Guy, a Democrat, who is retiring after 12 years in office.

title: COMMODITY PRICES LISTED FOR WEEK.
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5The Bureau of Labor Statistics reported today the following spot primary prices for the week ended Aug. 29.

title: Murder in Munich
description: That Arab fanatics could engage in indiscriminate murder, kidnapping and aerial hijacking was proved long ago. But yesterday's murderous assault in Munich plumbed new depths of criminality. By choosing the Olympic Games as the occasion for their bloody foray,. the Arab terrorists made it plain that their real target was civilized conduct among nations, not merely Israel or the Israeli athletes captured and killed yesterday. If the Olympic Games could provide a setting for release of their homicidal hatreds, then the same threat would hang over every United Nations meeting and all other international gatherings called to promote peace and friendship among nations.

title: Rhode Island Votes Taken
description: PROVIDENCE, R. I., Sept. 5 (AP)Public school teachers in five Rhode Island communities voted today to remain off the job if contract disputes were not resolved by the scheduled opening of classes tomorrow.

title: 4 Agriculture Officials Cleared In Inquiry on Subsidy Violations
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5 (UPI) The Agriculture Department said today that an exhaustive inquiry had found no evidence of willful wrongdoing by four officials of Its Agricultural Stabilization and Conservation Service in Kern County, Calif., one of the nation's heaviest cotton producing areas.

title: HEINZ ANNOUNCES RECORD EARNINGS
description: Operations of the H. J. Heinz Company in its first fiscal quarter ended Aug. 2 resulted in record sales and earnings, the Pittsburghbased food company reported yesterday.

title: New Phoenix Troupe Tries Wings
description: The cast of 17 sat on metal camp chairs as Stephen Porter, director with the New Phoenix Repertory Company, advised them on what to expect during the next five weeks of rehearsal of Moliere's Don Juan.

title: Search for 2 on Raft Fails
description: OSWEGO, N.Y., Sept 5 (AP)The Coast Guard has ended its participation in a search of Lake Ontario for two college students who disappeared five days ago after setting out for a ride on a small plastic raft. A sea, air and shoreline search has turned up no clues to the whereabouts of Ronald Rossi, 21 years old, of Endicott, and Miss Judith Ansalone, 18, of Hamburg, both students at Oswego State College.

title: AGENCIES PRODDED IN ECOLOGY FIGHT
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5Robert Cahn, resigning today as a member of the Council on Environmental Quality, said that there still was a lack of wholehearted compliance by Federal agencies with laws aimed at improving the nation's quality of life..

title: Cubs Vanquish Mets, 30; Seaver Loses, Hurt Again
description: The Mets' long summer of miseries reached a low point last night when Tom Seaver strained or tore a muscle while they were dropping a 3.0 decision to the Chicago Cubs in Shea Stadium.

title: Notes on People
description: Emperor Hirohito of Japan said he would like to keep a promise he made 50 years ago to visit the United States. The 71yearold Emperor, at his annual news conference, said that in addition to visiting Europe for purposes of goodwill, I must visit America, too.

title: About Motor Sports
description: The strong Corvette teams that regularly run the circuit of the International Motor Sports Association and the TransAm Mustangs and Camaros appearing for the first time in an IMSA event will meet in what should be an interesting endurance match this weekend at Watkins Glen, N.Y. The fiveliter TransAm sedans give away about two liters in engine size to the Corvettes, but they do have the advantage of six years of factory development, while the Corvettes generally have had to make do with development by private teams. Watkins Glen statistics of previous races show lap times for the TransAm machines about two seconds quicker than the Corvettes.

title: Pickup in Plant Outlays Predicted for Final Half
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5Business investment in plant and equipment is expected to rise in the third and fourth quarters of this year after falling short of projections for the second quarter, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: Manes Calls for Innovative LowIncome Coop at Controversial Forest Hills Site
description: Borough President Donald R. Manes of queens yesterday offered a new concept for the controversial Forest Hills low income housing project that he called, innovative and possibly the first of its kind in the country.

title: Shubert Books Big Band
description: George A. Hamid Jr. will present The Big Band, under the direction of Frankie Lester, former vocalist with the Tommy Dorsey orchestra, at the Shubert Theater for a limited engagement beginning Sept. 27. The band, which will seek to capture the sights and the sounds of the big bands of the 1930's and 1940's, will consist of 14 instrumentalists and three vocalists.

title: Brazil to Free Thousands To Mark Independence Day
description: BRASILIA, Sept. 5 (AP)President Emilio G. Medici commuted thousands of prison sentences today to mark the 150th anniversary of Brazil's independence.

title: New Editor in Waterbury
description: WATERBURY, Conn., Sept. (AP)Robert Veilette has been named city editor of The Waterbury Republican by the publisher, William 3. Pape. He succeeds Craig Vollmer, who joined a Vermont newspaper.

title: EDITH FAULSTICH, 65, STAMP EXPERT, DIES
description: Edith Margaret Faulstich, one of the best known women among stamp collectors, died Monday of cancer at United Hospital, Port Chester, N. Y. Mrs. Faulstich, who was 65 years Old, and her husband, Fred, also well known as a stamp collector, made their home in Yonkers.

title: Western Air Gets New Line of Credit
description: Western Air Lines announced yesterday that it had signed an amendment to its loan agreement with the Bank of America that would provide an additional $65million line of credit. The new borrowing will be on a revolving basis until Dec. 31, 1973.

title: Cooking Schools in the Suburbs: To Polish Old Skills or Acquire New Ones
description: Suburban adult education programs are expanding the number and variety of cooking courses offered this year. They are always considerably less expensive than private lessons, but there are usually more students in a class and less participation is involved. Many of the adult education instructors also give private lessons in their own kitchens. Almost every community has a cooking school. No attempt has been made to evaluate the classes listed here.

title: Grand Jury Hears 18 on Police Killing Of Boy, 11, in Chase
description: A Staten Island grand jury heard 18 witnesses yesterday as it began an investigation into the fatal shooting of an 11yearold black boy by a policeman.

title: GIANTS ARE READY, WILLING AND ABLE
description: The training season is really over for the New York Giants, even though they still have one exhibition game to play (at Yankee Stadium Sunday against Cleveland), and it can be called an unqualified success.

title: Olympic Personalities: Cuba Benefits From Soviet Aid
A 23HOUR DRAMA
description: MUNICH, West Germany, Wednesday, Sept. 6Eleven members of Israel's Olympic team and four Arab terrorists were killed yesterday in a 23hour drama that began with an invasion of the Olympic Village by the Arabs. It ended in a shootout at a military airport some 15 miles away as the Arabs were preparing to fly to Cairo with their Israeli hostages.

title: Jeweler Fatally Wounded In Queens Holdup Attempt
description: A 75yearold Queens jeweler was fatally wounded yesterday afternoon in his Long Island City store by one of three young men in a holdup attempt.

title: Briton Slain in Chicago
description: CHICAGO, Sept. 5 (AP)A teenage girl identified as a visitor from Britain was beaten to death yesterday in Grant Park. She had registered at the Y.W.C.A. as Judith Bettelley of StokeonTrent, the police said. Her age and purpose of her visit to Chicago were not determined.

title: Nixon Tightens Security In U.S Against Outlaws
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5 President Nixon said today that extra security measures would be taken in the United States to protect American citizens as well as visiting Israelis from possible attacks by Palestinian guerrillas.

title: COAST TOWNS GET INTERRACIAL HELP
description: MENLO PARK, Calif., Sept. 5  Eight young black men showed up at Mrs. Josephine M. Jackson's front door one day recently and offered to paint her house without charge.

title: Engineer Fights Drug Sentence, Cites Total Lack of Evidence
description: MINEOLA, L. I., Sept. 5An attorney for Lawrence A. Tate, a former executive of the International Business Machines Corporation, said today that Mr. Tate's conviction on charges of maintaining a disorderly house and obstructing governmental operations had been based largely on two briar pipes found after a 14man police raid.

title: RULING IS DISPUTED ON DETROIT BUSING
description: CINCINNATI, Sept. 5 (UPI)Michigan's Attorney General, Frank J. Kelley, today presented written arguments taking issue with virtually every recommendation made by the Detroit school desegregation panel appointed by United States District Judge Stephen Roth.

title: RABBI A. G. WEISSMAN
description: Rabbi Azriel G. Weissman, a vice president of the Rabbinical Council of America and for many years spiritual leader of Congregation Derech Emunah at 53 Charles Street, died yesterday after suffering a heart attack recently. He was.58 years old and lived at 430 East Sixth Street.

title: Bridge: Michael Becker Wins Twice In Knickerbocker Tourney
Police Query 30 City Detectives About GetRichQuick Swindle
description: The anticorruption unit of the Police Department has asked 30 detectives whether they invested money with an alleged swindler in Queens who promised a return of from 1 to 3 per cent interest a week, according to high law enforcement officials.

title: Rockland Teachers Picket In Three School Districts
description: NEW CITY, N. Y., Sept. 5Picket lines were set up today in three of the seven Rockland County school districts where teachers have voted not to work without a contract.

title: PARLEY REJECTS HIJACKING TREATY
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5Delegates to a 17nation conference here rejected today United StatesCanadian efforts to negotiate an international antihijacking treaty based on a draft proposed by the two nations.

title: Storm Hits Salt Lake City
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Sept. 5 (AP)A severe thunderstorm with winds gusting to 70 miles an hour struck the Salt Lake City area early today causing widespread power outages and snarling traffic. One radio station was knocked off the air and a number of mostly minor traffic accidents were reported.

title: STOCKS RETREAT AS RALLY FIZZLES
description: The stock market closed slightly lower in dull trading yesterday apparently affected by postholiday doldrums. The market was closed Monday because of Labor Day.

title: TV at the Olympic Village: Missed Opportunity
description: Live via Satellite From Munich.

title: Market Place Studying Risks In Tax Shelters
description: It was just a small ad tucked away in the back of The New York Times yesterday, but it was certain to raise a few eyebrowsif not among investors, at least in the financial community.

title: MOSCOW ACCUSES CHINA ON LIN PIAO
description: MOSCOW, Sept. 5The Soviet Union accused China today of distorting the Lin Piao affair and resorting to absurd inventions by implying that the Russians had somehow colluded with the late Chinese Defense Minister in his alleged plot aginst Chairman Mao Tsetung a year ago.

title: CHARCOAL POWDER TERMED ANTIDOTE
description: Editors of the British Medical Journal, citing studies performed by American researchers, point out how the rediscovery of activated charcoal is helping to save the lives of people who have swallowed poisons and overdoses of drugs.

title: SILVER FUTURES CLIMB SHARPLY
description: Based on activity in London, silver and copper futures rose sharply yesterday on the Commodity Exchange here.

title: CANADA PRESSES SEARCH FOR ART
description: MONTREAL, Sept. 5 (Reuters)The police today called on Interpol, the international police agency, to assist in catching the robbers who stole $2million in art objects yesterday from the Montreal Museum of Fine Arts.

title: Boy Burned to Death
description: SAN GABRIEL, Calif., Sept. 5 (AP)A 13yearold boy, Antonio Espinoza, burned to death yesterday when he fell off his bicycle into a wire mesh fence that was inadvertently charged with 2,300 volts of electricity, the police said. The fence surrounded a construction project along the San Bernardino Freeway, and the authorities said than an electrical wire had apparently, been unearthed during the operation and somehow made contact with the fence.

title: BOSTON STUDY FINDS BUSING NEED SLIGHT
description: BOSTON, Sept. 5 (AP).  A feasibility study commissioned by the Department of Health, Education and Welfare has found that Boston schools could comply with state and Federal desegregation laws with a minimum of additional busing.

title: Play on Homosexual Life On View Here Tomorrow
description: Coming Out, the first work for the stage produced by the Gay Activists Alliance, will be on view at 8 P.M. at the Washington Square Methodist Church, 133 West Fourth Street, from tomorrow through Sept. 17, except for Monday.

title: Lebanon Expels Newsman
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Sept. 5 (Reuters)  Lebanon tonight ordered Roger Wilkinson, a United Press International correspondent, to leave the country within 24 hours on the ground that he had cabled false reports to his headquarters. Mr. Wilkinson, a Briton, has been stationed in Beirut for a year. He had served earlier with U.P.I. in Cairo. The announcement gave no other details.

title: FRANCIS B. FIRENZE OF REALTY CONCERN
description: WESTBURY, L.I., Sept. 5Francis B. Firenze, a vice president of HelmsleySpear, Inc., realestate organization, died yesterday. He was 48 years old and lived at 178 Salem Road.

title: Berrigan and a Nun Get Prison Terms In Letter Smuggling
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., Sept. 5The Rev. Philip F. Berrigancleared of charges that he led a plot to kidnap President Nixon's adviser on national security affairs, Henry A. Kissinger was sentenced in Federal District Court here today to four concurrent twoyear terms for smuggling letters out of the Lewisburg Penitentiary.

title: Sketches of Victims
description: TEL AVIV, Sept. 5Following are sketches of Israeli team members who were involved in the clash with Arab cothmandos in Munich.

title: GAMES SUSPENDED; RITES IN ARENA SET
description: MUNICH, West Germany, Wednesday, Sept. 6  The Olympic Games were suspended yesterday for the first time since competition in the modern era began in 1896.

title: Cutting Addict Crime
description: Encouraging evidence that voluntary entrance into the city's methadone maintenance program by drug addicts materially cuts their tendency to commit crimes is provided in a report to Mayor Lindsay and his Narcotic Control Council from Health Services Administrator Gordon Chase.

title: Public School Enrollment In Jersy Continue Rise
description: Publicschool pupils, their number still growing but at a slower pace, head back to classrooms today and tomorrow in New Jersey's 581 school districts, with enrollment expected to rise this year by 37,000 to a total of 1,535,000, according to Dr. M. Jack Krupnick, chief statistician of the state's Department of Education.

title: WASHINGTON
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5The tragedy at the Olympic Games is just the latest reminder that there is now a kind of madness in the world, a lunatic strain of anarchy that hinders the peace and order of mankind.

title: WALTER REYNOLDS OF TOILETRY FIRM
description: WHITE PLAINS, Sept. 5 H. Walter Reynolds, formerly general counsel of the ColgatePalmolive Company, died of a heart attack today at St. Agnes Hospital. He was 71 years old and lived at 265 Worthington Road.

title: Mayor, Citing Good Faith Aura, Hopeful ofA verting School Strike
description: Mayor Lindsay said yesterday he was hopeful that a city teachers strike threatened for next Monday would be averted.

title: MRS. MEIR SPEAKS
description: JERUSALEM, Sept. 5Her voice heavy and trembling with emotion, Premier Golda Meir today denounced these lunatic acts of terrorism, abduction and blackmail, which tear asunder the web of international life.

title: DETROIT TEACHERS SHUN SALARY RISE
description: DETROIT, Sept. 5Detroit's teachers' union and the Board of Education agreed today to oneyear contract with no new pay increase.

title: Jersey Consumer Agency Raids Store
description: PATERSON, Sept. 5New Jersey's Division of Consumer Affairs raided a neighborhood grocery here today to drama. tize the problems of consumer fraud in the inner city.

title: MonthOld Oil Spill in Maine Still Remains to Be Cleaned
description: AUGUSTA, Me., Sept. 5 (UPI) Residents of Casco Bay Islands say their beaches have not been cleaned up, yet from a massive oil spill early last month.

title: Kennedy to Accompany 9City McGovern Tour
description: LOS ANGELES, Sept. 5Senator Edward M. Kennedy. who turned down an offer of the Democratic nomination for Vice President, will join Senator George McGovern next week on a ninecity campaign tour through the Middle West and East.

title: TAX CREDITS OPPOSED BY RELIGIOUS GROUPS
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5 (UPI) Coalitions of Jewish and Baptist groups joined school board Members and the American Civil Liberties Union today in opposing a System of tax credits for private and religious schools.

title: Schmitz Belittles Democrats
description: RICHMOND, Sept. 5 (UPI)The American party Presidential candidate, John G. Schmitz, said today that his ticket would do better than the Democrats in the November election. Mr. Schmitz, who toured four Virginia cities, said Senator George McGovern had no chance of winning because of his party's busing and amnesty platform.

title: Political Retreat
description: The AdminiStration seems to be exercising some more of its famous flexibility in governmental policy as a means of wooing the labor vote into the Nixon column. The White House has denied reports that it is quietly laying to rest the Philadelphia Plan, introduced with much blaring of trumpets three years ago as a symbol of, its determination to break down the walls of racial exclusion built by construction craft unions. But all the external evidence points to a policy of slow extinction through nonenforcement.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Lindsay and Lowery Lead Tribute to Dead Fireman
description: Mayor Lindsay and Fire Commissioner Robert O. Lowery led more than 700 officials and members of the Fire Department yesterday as Fireman First Grade Henry H. Mitchell of Brooklyn was honored with a deputy chief's funeral from the New Hope Baptist Church, 1328 Park Place, in the Crown Heights section.

title: $15,000 Penalty Is Paid For Illicit Charter Flights
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5 (AP) The Civil Aeronautics Board collected a $15,000 penalty today from two Brooklyn organizations and their operators for illicit transAtlantic charterflight activity.

title: Navy Trains Whales to Retrieve Torpedoes From Ocean Bottom
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5 The Navy announced today a breakthrough of sorts in underea., technology with the disclosure that whales have been trained to retrieve objects, such as torpedoes from depths of 1,500 feet or more in return for an occasional snack of fish.

title: TITO THREATENS HOSTILE GROUPS
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Sept. 5Yugoslavia's latesummer respite, when officialdom puts aside all but the most urgent problems and disappears for vacation, has ended abruptly with a stern warning by President Tito that Communist ranks must be purged and tightened to combat dissidents, nationalists and a new class of wealth and privilege.

title: EBERLE DISSENTS ON TRADE REPORT
description: PARIS, Sept. 5A highlevel international report on trade and economic relationsaccompanied by a dissenting United States opinionwas issued here today.

title: Exchanges Seek to Nullify Big Beard's Transfer Tax
description: BOSTON, Sept. 5 (UPI)The Boston Stock Exchange and five other regional exchanges have filed suit to invalidate the New York stock transfer tax, it was disclosed, today.

title: Guerrillas, in Cairo, Take Responsibility for Attack
description: CAIRO, Sept. 5 (Reuters)An Arab guerrilla organization called Black September claimed responsibility today for the attack on Israeli athletes quarters at the Olympic Village in Munich.

title: CONTRACT AWARDS
description: The Western Elecric Company, a unit of the American Telephone & Telegraph Company, received a $24million Navy contract for oceanographic equipment and research, it was announced yesterday.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAING
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5In the next few days, a carefully chosen team of veteran politicians will fan out across the country to celebrate and defend the Presidency of Richard M. Nixon.

title: Boy Dies in Upstate Fire
description: SPRINGVILLE, N.Y., Sept. 5 (AP)An early morning fire destroyed a small cabin today, killing one boy and seriously burning another. The police in this community south of Buffalo said Theodore Papke, 16, Years old, perished in the fire. John Schunk, 15, was reported in critical condition in the Burn Treatment Center of Emergency Hospital Buffalo.

title: VincentPapaPleads Guilty in Drug Case And Is Given 5 Years
description: Vincent C. Papa, identified by Federal authorities as one of the nation's biggest distributors of heroin, pleaded guilty yesterday to taxevasion and narcoticspossession charges and was sentenced to five years in prison.

title: Peking Report Says Hanoi Sees Truce Near Election Time
description: PEKING, Sept. 5 (Reuters)Seriior North Vietnamese offidais have hinted that the Indochina war could possibly end before or shortly after the American Presidential election in November, travelers back froin Hanoi said here today.

title: Credit Markets
description: The Federal Reserve sold $250million of Treasury bills yesterday, presumably for a foreign central bank, and the action pushed rates on these shortterm securities to their highest level since late September last year. At the close of the credit markets, threemonth Treasury bills were quoted at a price that gave short term investors who bought them a rate of 4.65 per cent. That is a jump of six tenths of a percentage point in a little more than a week. The drop in bill prices and the sharp climb in bill rates  some jumped as much as 17 basis points, hundredths of a percentage point, yesterdayaffected Treasury notes and bonds, pushing their prices down sharply.

title: Inside the Building: Story of an Israeli Who Escaped
description: MUNICH, West Germany, Sept. 5Shaul Ladany, an Israeli walking racer, was deep in a very good sleep in his dormitory at Olympic Village this morning when his roommates heard noises, peered out and saw a body being dragged out of another Israeli apartment below.

title: 752 AirConditioned cars Ordered for City Subavas
description: Mayor Lindsay announced yesterday that 752 new airconditioned subway cars had been ordered for $210.5million. He said the contract Was the largest ever signed in the country for the purchase of passenger railroad cars.

title: Claim to McDaniels Dropped
description: GREENSBORO, N. C., Sept 5 (UPI)  The Carolina Cougars of the American Basketball Association announced today they had dropped all claim to Jim McDaniels, who defected to the National Basketball Association's Seattle Supersonics in February. A Cougar spokesman said terms of the agreement were not announced but the Cougars reportedly received more than half a million dollars.

title: 3 FILMS ANNOUNCED BY DIRECTORS GROUP
description: The Directors Company, the newly formed production company jointly owned by Paramount Pictures and Peter Bogdanovich, FrancIs Ford Coppola and William Friedkin, announced yesterday the first three of a series of films it will make over a sixyear period.

title: Business Briefs
description: The trustee for the Farrington Manufacturing Company has filed a plan for reorganization aimed at keeping the company in the domestic and overseas imprinter business without further court protection, it was announced yesterday.

title: Cuban Stops Bobick in the 3d, Ending Heavyweight's Streak
description: MUNICH, West Germany, Sept. 5 (AP)Duane Bobick, the American heavyweight, was stopped in the third round today by Tvofilo Stevenson of Cuba in a stunning Olympic upset. Stevenson knocked Bobick down twice in the third round.

title: Navy Kin Arrive in Athens to Set Up Housekeeping
description: ATHENS, Sept. 5Some 300 American families landed in Piraeus today to the gay music of a welcoming bouzouki band to join husbands and fathers serving with a United States destroyer squadron that is now using the Athens area as a home port.

title: Shriver Stages Campaign Visuals in Visits to 3 New England Cities
description: SPRINGFIELD, Mass., Sept. 5  Sargent Striver reached three centers of New England television today in a busy schedule of what his staff called campaign visuals  meaning colorful events staged primarily for TV cameras.

title: Business Briefs
description: TOKYO, Sept. 5 (Reuters)The Mitsubishi Trust Bank expects to open a representative office in London next month to participate in the Eurodollar market, a spokesman said today.

title: Divorce Becomes Final For Johnny Carson's Wife
description: Joanne Carson's uncontested divorce from the entertainer johny carson, obtained by her on June 21 in state Supreme court here, became final yes terday. Mrs. carson, who was represented by Alfred S. Julian, had charged cruel and inhuman treatment

title: Removal of Ricord From Nassau Jail Sought by Sheriff
description: EAST MEADOW, L. I., Sept. 5Sheriff Michael P. Seniuk of Nassau County demanded today that the Federal Government immediately remove Auguste Joseph Ricord, described as the top man in a multimilliondollar heroin smuggling ring, from the Nassau jail.

title: ISSUES 1972
description: PARISTo the long controversy between critics of U.S. bombing of North Vietnamese dikes and the American Administration, it is now possible to add new elements to the available evidence. They are the result of a geographical analysis of the points in the dike network that have been hit by bombs.

title: Congress Returns
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5 Congress returned from an 18day recess today, eager to adjourn for the fall campaign but still snailed over such issues as school busing revenue sharhig and arms control.

title: Economic Analysis
description: Long after the campaign posters have yellowed, the lasting significance of a national election is likely to be the burial of an old social or economic policy or the birth of a new one. And sometimes the new idea comes first in what appears to be an utterly impractical form. Such was the case with the Townsend Plan 40 years ago. As Robert Bendiner has written in his history of the Great Depression, Just Around the Corner: Where Father Coughlin cried, Cheapen our money, and Huey Long said, Call in the whole pie and cut it up all over again, Dr. Francis E. Townsend, gentlest and least selfseeking of the Big Three dreamers, hawked a crankier scheme than either.

title: Spitz Arrives in London, Calls Arab Attack Tragic
description: LONDON, Sept. 5 (Reuters)Mark Spitz, the American swimmer who has won seven gold medals in the 1972 Olympics, flew hurriedly from Munich to London today after Arab commandos attacked the Olympic Village.

title: Kennedy Letters Appeal For Funds for McGovern
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5 (UPI) Senator Edward M. Kennedy, in letters to about 1.2 million Americans, has appealed for financial donations to Senator George McGovern's Democratic Presidential campaign. McGovern campaign headquarters said the last of the letters from the Massachusetts Democrat were mailed Tuesday. Each was accompanied by a pledge card inviting prospective contributors to join the McGovern millionmember club.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Steel Production Up 3.9% for Week; Highest Since June
description: Production of steel last week climbed to 2,524,000 net tons, the American Iron and Steel Institute reported yesterday.

title: Team Canada a Little Prouder After It Cools Off Soviet Six
description: TORONTO, Sept. 5  It was, as QuebecPresse screamed across its front page today, Vengeance Personelle.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAING
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5John N. Mitchell, the former director of President Nixon's reelection campaign, completed today his secret testimony in connection with the breakin at the Democratic national headquarters and later repeated denials that he had any advance knowledge of the incident.

title: U.S., ALASKA SETTLE DISPUTE OVER LAND
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5 (AP)  The Interior Department announced today an agreement with Alaska concerning 40 million acres of land claimed by that state and the Federal Government.

title: EQUITY FINANCING
description: The Sabine Royalty Corporation yesterday filed a registration statement with the Securities and Exchange Commission in connection with a proposed offering of 300,000 shares of its common stock. An underwriting group headed by Smith, Barney & Co., Inc. will manage the offering. The company's stock was down 1 at 33 on the American Stock Exchange.

title: Berlioz Vs. Park's Bongos
description: Much Ado About Nothing has been enjoying a bumper season in Central Park. On the heels of the closing of the New York Shakespeare Festival's version, by A. J. Antoon, the park saw one of the rare performances of Hector Berlioz's setting, Beatrice et Benedict.

title: DOUGLAS GRANTS BAIL TO VETERANS
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5As sociate Justice William O. Douglas ordered the release on bail today of four members of the Vietnam Veterans Against the War who have been held since Aug. 9 for refusing to testify before a Federal grand jury in Tallahassee, Fla.

title: With Cosmetics It's Not Only Snob Appeal vs. Lower Price Tags
description: There is, according to J. Tylee Wilson, a corporate vice president of ChesebroughPond's, an awful lot of psychology in the cosmetics business.q A return and exchange policy that guarantees customer satisfaction and frequently allows stores to return merchandise at periodic intervals. Returns can run from 6 to 15 per cent of shipments and one manufacturer estimated that his company took back several million dollars worth of perfectly good products annually. Most returned products are destroyed.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: THE 1972 CAMPAING
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Sept. 5 (AP)  Jean Westwood, the Democratic national chairman, said today that she was fairly sure that an attempt was made last week to bug the party's national headquarters in the Watergate apartments in Washington, the scene of an earlier alleged eavesdropping try.

title: 2 Injured Jets Work Out
description: HEMPSTEAD, L.I., Sept. 5Ralph Baker, a linebacker, and Richie Caster, a tight end, who had been sidelined with knee injuries, worked out with the Jets today at Hofstra, increasing hopes they'would be available for the Sept. 17 league opener against the Buffalo Bills. They will not play in the Jets final preseason game Saturday night against the Chargers in San Diego.

title: ARGENTINES KIDNAP A DUTCH EXECUTIVE
description: BUENOS AIRES, Sept. 5 (Reuters)A Dutch industrialist, Jan Van de Panne, was kidnapped here today shortly after he left his suburban home, police sources said.

title: Nickel Price Is Increased By Sherritt Gordon Mines
description: Sherritt Gordon Mines, Ltd., said in Toronto yesterday that it had increased its base price for nickel briquettes and powder sold in Canada by 20 cents a pound, to $1.53 cents in United Staes funds.

title: Young Ascetics Honor Lord Krishna
description: MOUNDSVILLE, W. Va., Sept. 4On the crown of a lovely green hill in the West Virginia countryside, under the aluminum roof of an open pavilion, the faithful gathered this week to chant the name of Lord Krishna and kneel at the feet of their spiritual master, a wrinkled brown man named A. C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada.

title: Monetary Confusion
description: By halting dollar convertibility into gold last year, the Nixon Administration shattered the world monetary system, which the United States had taken the lead in creating after World War II. Thirteen months have now passed since Washington called for negotiation of arrangements more favorable to America's changed economic position, but the world is still waiting for this country to reveal the kind of monetary system it wants.

title: Saigon Plans CourtMartial For Quangtri Commander
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Sept. 5 (Reuters)Gen. Vu Van Giai, who ordered his troops to retreat from Quangtri during the North Vietnamese offensive in April, is to face a courtmartial soon, the official agency Vietnam Press reported today.

title: Power Cut Off in San Juan
description: SAN JUAN, P. R., Sept. 5 (UPI)A breakdown at one power substation caused a chainreaction at other substations in the city that left San Juan's 750,000 residents without electric power for almost two hours today. A spokesman for the Governmentoperated Water Resources Authority said the original breakdown, in the city's financial district, had caused breakdowns at other relay stations around the city. By noon, service had been restored to most of the city.

title: Leaders Around the World Express Horror at the Guerrilla Attack at Olympics
description: The Arab guerrilla attack on the Israeli Olympic team brought forth worldwide condemnation and expressions of horror yesterday.

title: Moon Trips Spawn a Galaxy of Inventions
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 5The Space Agency which likes to share with industry what it has learned on the way to the moon, has established a detailed catalogue of 1,892 inventions available for license. It offers rights to more than 30 patents and patent applications on fireproof and fireresistant materials, firemen's suits and helmets and flamefree women's wear.

title: ExGambler, 82, Spins Back Wheel of Time
description: GENEVA, N.Y.  Cornelius J. Dwyer, 82 years old and hearty, sat on the veranda of his Romanesque castle here and, with the candor and comfort of someone who has beat the statute of limitations, discoursed freely on his years in the bootlegging, gambling and corruption business and how he thinks times and crimes have changed.

title: Kissinger to Meet With Soviet Leaders
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., Sept. 5The White House announced today that Henry A.
